loans.name: Abizeye C Tcb Group

texts.en:
Marie Rose is a group leader. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children, aged between 11 and 23 years old.

This group is called ABIZEYE which means “BELIEVERS” in English. They sell various Items and they wish to expand their businesses in order to have a better future.

Marie Rose sells small fish and has been running this business for the past 5 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more small fish to sell. With the profits from the business she would like to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Posian

texts.en:
Posian is married with children. He has operated a retail shop for 10 years. With the proceeds, his family does not lack anything given the fact that he works hard toward providing for them.

Posian started business with 1 million shillings, but right now he has stock of 6 million. He has a responsibility of paying school fees for his children, which he does on time and is so happy about their progress.

He is doing great in his shop, but he is faced with challenges of price fluctuation and inflation. This, however, does not deter him from adding unique stock to sell this festive season.

Posian is in need of a loan to buy home products like glasses, metallic plates, dishes and many others to sell.

loans.use: to buy home products like glasses, metallic plates, dishes and many others to sell.

loans.name: Almagul

texts.ru: Алмагуль, 55 лет, замужем, воспитали 2 детей. У нее - высшее образование, работает учителем начальных классов в школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Алмагуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Алмагуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алмагуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота и удоя экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Алмагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Almagul is 55 years old, married, and has raised 2 children. She has a post-secondary education, and works as a grade school teacher.

As additional income for her family, Almagul raises animals, which she began doing 19 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Almagul's very hard work, her farm now has 4 cows and 15 sheep. Her monthly income is 18,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her farm, Almagul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy dairy cows, which will increase her herd's headcount and her volume of organic milk for sale. Almagul plans to use the income from her loan to continue increasing her number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy some dairy cows to increase her organic milk sales.

loans.name: Phu

texts.en: Phu is a 31-year-old single man. There are five people in his family. This loan can help him to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for his family as well as environment protection.  Animal husbandry and working for a salary are the main income source for his family so he is able to pay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Richco Group

texts.en:
This group by the name of Richco was formed in March 2013. It consists of men and a woman who, for the most part, have acquired a great deal of experience in small retail businesses, which happens to be their main activity.

Grace (standing with her counterparts in the photo), is the group's featured borrower. She is 33 years old and is a single parent of two children. She sells lining cloths.

Grace intends to use her loan to buy more lining cloth to satisfy her customers' need due to the festive Christmas season ahead. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education, healthcare needs, and to buy them clothes with more commitment in paying the loan.

loans.use: to buy lining cloth to sell.

loans.name: Done Group

texts.en:
Kids love it when they open their lunch box at school and find tasty packets of corn snacks and other tasty treats like fruit. This is what leads these parents to the likes of Anna a 52 year old business lady who specializes in selling various types of snacks and bananas.

Anna is a member of Done group, she and her group members reside in one of the oldest, well-known, high density locations of Highfields, Harare. She is a widow and mother of 3. She raised her children very well and today the first one is a teacher, the other is a medical doctor and she is teaching the third child how to run the snacks and bananas business.

Anna did exceptionally well on her first loan cycle when she successfully applied for a loan of $400 and restocked snacks of different flavors directly from the manufacturers in industries around Harare. Flavors that she usually stocks include tomato, onion, cheese, fruit and chutney, chicken, beef and vinegar among others. Anna also sells popped maize seeds known as ‘maputi’ in Shona.

She sells her products in a very busy local market. She acts as a wholesaler for her clients because she sells all of her products in bulk. Arising from good business management Anna expanded into selling bulk bananas.

Currently Anna requires a loan of $800. With this loan, Anna intends to fully restock her snacks business, since business will be at the peak during these times when children are still going to school. Anna also intends to buy a lorry so that she may be able to deliver some of her bulk products to her clients for free in order to create strong customer loyalty.

loans.use: to fully restock her snack business.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuan, 53 years old, is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. Animal husbandry is the main income source for her family. Additionally, she also works as a hired labour and earns about 120,000 VND per day.

With this loan, Mrs. Thuan can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs. Lan is a hardworking 38-year-old woman.  She is married and has two children. Her income is mainly from animal husbandry and cultivation. She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her parents, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Anarkhan

texts.ru: Анархан успешно погасила свой кредит, она использовала средства по целевому назначению и очень благодарна за помощь Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря ее упорному труду, на сегодня товарооборот Анархан  в магазине - около 47,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход около 13,000 сом (KGS). Анархан решила вновь обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товара в магазине, приобретет продукты питания и прохладительные напитки. Доходы от кредита Анархан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что поможет ей улучшить благосостояние семьи и накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Anarkhan successfully repaid her loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is thankful to Kiva for the help, and to everyone who helped with her financing.

Thanks to Anarkhan's very hard work, her store now has goods in stock worth around 47,000 som (KGS). Her monthly income is around 13,000 som (KGS).

Anarkhan decided to apply again to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the assortment of goods in her shop. She will purchase grocery items and soft drinks. Anarkhan will use the income from her loan to continue developing her business, which will help her increase her family's well-being and save for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Cholponai

texts.ru: Чолпонай погасила свой кредит, она использовала средства по назначению и очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто ей помог в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду, Чолпонай на сегодняшний день имеет 1 дойная корова, 15 овец, 7 лошадей. На участке мерою 2,40 Га собственной земли она выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры, эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпонай вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Cholponai successfully repaid her loan, using the funds for their designated purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with her financing.

Thanks to Cholponai's very hard work, she now has 1 milk cow, 15 sheep, and 7 horses. On a 2.40 hectare plot of her own land, she grows potatoes, grain, and sainfoin for resale and on-farm consumption.

In order to continue developing her business, Cholponai has again applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow so that she can sell organic milk. She plans to use the income from her loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow to increase her amount of organic milk for sale.

loans.name: Jali's Group

texts.en:
Jali is a simple and a charming lady. She is standing to the left hand side in the photograph. She is a single mother and has two beautiful daughters in her care. She is a humble resident of a town in Odagaon, Odisha, India. Sustainability and survival are two different things. If you sustain, you can survive, but survival does not guarantee sustainability. Jali has learnt this in practice, and practice is what has made her perfect. She is sustaining to survive.

Jali has been engaged in embroidering cushion covers, curtains, and tablecloths for the past three years. She has acquired this skill from her mother, whom she considers as her role model. Jali's products sell like hotcakes in the market due to her beautiful designs. She has a large customer base and supplies her products in the required time. Seeing the rise in the number of her customers, Jali, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum.

Jali will use her portion of the loan amount to buy colorful thread, wool, stones, ribbons, glue, and other necessary items in bulk so as to match her supply with the rising demand of the customers. The loan amount will ultimately result in upgrading her living standard.

Jali is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy colorful thread, wool, stones, ribbons, glue, and other necessary items in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
A sus 27 años de edad Ana logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo trabajando en varios talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene un buen negocio. 

Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una mesa de corte y una cortadora de tela con la que podrá mejorar su producción, expandirse a nuevas empresas, y aumentar  su volumen de trabajo; dándole así, la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así, contar la historia de que gracias a los colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At her 27 years of age, Ana has been able to consolidate a business of making third-party and her own line of clothing thanks to the experience she got working in various workshops. She works from Monday to Saturday between 9 and 11 hours daily, depending on the quantity of work. She knows that it is thanks to her clients that she has a good business.

Ana wishes to expand her horizons and be able to offer work to people who are in most need. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a cutting table and a fabric-cutting machine with which she will be able to improve her production, expand to new businesses and increase the volume of work, thus giving a work opportunity to another person.

Ana's dream is to continue growing, form a workshop, and thus, be able to tell the story that thanks to the Kiva contributors and lenders and the help of Corporacion Interactuar, she was able to put together a great business.

loans.use: to buy a cutting table and a fabric-cutting machine with which she will be able to improve her production

loans.name: Kamala's Group

texts.en:
Kamala is a differently abled lady standing to the left hand side in the photograph. Kamala’s husband is a farmer. Until seven years ago, that was the only source of income for the family. As her two daughters started growing up, she became apprehensive about their future. Kamala herself could never study beyond primary school, but wanted her daughters to have the opportunity to get educated and become independent.

With this motivation, she started her cow-rearing business. It was something that did not require any special training or skills. Nor did it require any special place; the open area around their house would be sufficient. And, whatever crop residue was weaned from their agricultural activity could be used as fodder for the cow.

Kamala, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy another cow. Combined with her savings, this would be enough to acquire another milch cow, doubling her income in the process.

Kamala is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул, 33 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, занимается полеводством и животноводством, как и все сельчане проживающие в одном селе вместе с ней. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул и активной помощи ее детей и супруга, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 20 овец и 2 тонны кукурузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 33 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has a specialist secondary education, and she does field and animal husbandry work, like all the villagers who live in the same village as she does.

Thanks to Ainagul's very hard work, and thanks to the active help of her children and spouse, her farm now has 4 cows, 20 sheep, and 2 tons of corn for on-farm consumption. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her farm, Ainagul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock to increase her herd's headcount. Ainagul plans to use the income from her loan to continue developing her business, and to build a barn.

loans.use: to buy some livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Dubis Judit

texts.es:
Dubis es una mujer independiente, trabajadora, madre de 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 9, se caracteriza por ser una persona paciente, tolerante, responsable y cuidosa, se dedica a prestar servicios de peluquería, un negocio que surgió de la necesidad económica y con el que espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y pagar la educación de sus niños.

Ella sueña con ser una gran empresaria, tener el negocio más popular de la zona, contar con empleadas, con una gran infraestructura y disfrutar de sus ganancias, comprando vivienda, automóvil, sueños locos que quiere volver realidad, sabe que todo comienza imaginándolo y pondrá todo de sí para alcanzar estos objetivos.

La cliente se dedica principalmente a realizar manicura y pedicura, pero se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para aumentar los servicios en su local, comprando activos para ofrecer cortes, cepillados, lisados entre otros, comprando lava-cabezas, sillas de peluquería e insumos como tintas, tratamientos, entre otros.

Espera que con esta inversión obtenga nuevos clientes y pueda aprovechar la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Dubis is a hard-working, independent woman. She is a 31 year old mother of two children aged 6 and 9 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship with her partner. She is a patient, responsible, tolerant and careful person who works offering beauty services. Her business was born from economic necessity and she hopes to improve the living conditions of her family with it and pay for the education of her children.

She dreams of becoming an important businessperson, having the most popular business in her area, having employees and a large infrastructure. To enjoy her earnings buy a house, an automobile, crazy dreams that she wants to make reality. She knows that everything starts with imagining it and putting everything into achieving your objectives.

The client works mainly giving manicures and pedicures but she finds herself requesting a loan to expand the services of her business, buying fixed assets to offer hair cuts, styling and straightening, amongst others. She will buy hair washing equipment, chairs for hair-cutting and supplies like dye and treatments amongst others.

She hopes that with this investment she can get new clients and take advantage of the end of the year season.

loans.use: to buy hair washing equipment. hair-cutting chairs and supplies like dye and treatments amongst others.

loans.name: Akoss

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Akoss est une femme âgée de 26 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Akoss est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales et des céréales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Akoss demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et de riz  en vue de mieux revendre et  d’en magasiné un grand nombre de stock puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari à promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en: Akoss is a 26 year-old women who lives in Adidogomé. She is married and the mother of two children.  Akoss is a general food products and cereals vendor. She buys her supplies four times per month at the market and resells them from a covered stall at the entrance to her home. Akoss is asking for this loan so she can order bags of corn and rice to resell and to stock a large inventory, in order to maximize her income. This will help her husband to provide school education for their children and to meet the family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of rice and 1 bag of corn

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesus

texts.es:
Consuelo es propietaria de un restaurante, tiene de 57 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 1 hijo. 

Su negocio viene operando desde finales desde el 2013 y ahora quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar adecuaciones en su cocina y así poder tener más espacio para trabajar.

Este crédito le permitirá continuar con la venta de comidas y seguir manteniéndose en el mercado, pues es quien genera los mayores ingresos en su hogar. 

Su sueño es poder pagar la educación de su hijo y comprarse una vivienda propia.
texts.en: Consuelo is the owner of a restaurant. She is 57 years old and lives with her husband and son. She has had her business since the end of 2013, and now she wants to request a loan to do remodeling in her kitchen to have more space to work. This loan will allow her to continue with her business selling food and keep herself in the market, because she is the one who generates most of the income of her household. Her dream is to be able to pay for her son's education and to buy her own house.

loans.use: to do remodeling in her kitchen to have more space to work.

loans.name: Carlos Abel

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 57 años de edad, todo un veterano y un viejo zorro en el tema de la ebanistería la cual aprendió empíricamente trabajando como empelado y que desempeña como independiente hace poco más de un mes, ya que considero que era el momento de buscar su propio camino y mejorar su calidad de vida, también asegurar trabajo en su vejez donde es tan difícil lograr conseguir un empleo.
Inicio su labor con su herramienta básica, pero aún necesita mucha maquinaria, es por este motivo que acude a una ayuda crediticia con la cual quiere comprar los activos restantes para desempeñar su profesión.
El dinero será para la compra de una máquina sin fin, una máquina cortadora, herramienta de mano, madera, aerosoles, clavos, pegamento entre otros.
texts.en: Carlos is a 57 year old man. He is a veteran and very savvy in everything related to cabinetmaking, that he learned by experience when working as an employee. For more than a month he has been working independently, because he considered this was the moment to look for his own way and improve his quality of life, and to assure work in his old age when it is so difficult to get employment. He started his work with his basic tool, but he still need many machines. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy the remaining assets to be able to work in his profession. The money will be to buy a band saw machine, a cutting machine, a hand tool, wood, aerosols, nails, glue, among other things.

loans.use: to buy a band saw machine, a cutting machine, a hand tool, wood, aerosols, nails, glue, among other things.

loans.name: José Ruben

texts.es:
José es un agricultor de 42 años que junto con su esposa Bessy Janeth se dedica al cultivo de diferentes productos de origen agrícola sus principales cultivos son el café y productos de hortaliza. José creció viendo cómo funcionan los procesos de la agricultora y ahora quiere poner en practica algunos conocimientos que ha adquirido durante su vida, Mario tiene experiencia de campo en el cultivo de muchos productos su meta es poder producir de una forma diversificada para tener varias fuentes de ingreso y además promover a que las personas consuman lo que se produce en la región.
José quiere iniciar un proyecto para la producción de tomates orgánicos bajo invernadero el producto cosechado lo comercializara por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, este cultivo es muy novedoso ya que el cultivo de tomate deja muy buenas ganancias además proporcionan fuentes de empleo para las personas.
José Solicita un crédito para iniciar a cultivar tomates orgánicos lo antes posible ya que él piensa que entre más rápido tengan nuevas fuentes de ingresos menos vulnerable será su economía ante la caída del precio de cualquiera de los productos que vende.
Un crédito ayudara a José a tener diversas fuentes de ingresos y por lo tanto le permitirá darle mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en: José is in agriculture, 42 years old, and together with his wife Bessy Janeth, is dedicated to cultivated different agriculture products. His main products are coffee and vegetables. José grew up seeing how agricultural processes function and now wants to put some of his knowledge he learned during his life into practice. Mario has field experience in the cultivation of many products. His goal is to be able to have a diversified way to have multiple sources of income and also encourage people to consume what is produced in the region. Jose wants to start a project to produce organic tomatoes in greenhouses that he will market through COCAFCAL, of which he is a partner. This crop is very new, and the tomato crop makes very good profits also provides jobs for people. José seeks a credit to start to grow organic tomatoes as soon as possible because he thinks that the sooner he has new sources of revenue, he will be less vulnerable economically to the falling price of any of the products he sells. A loan helped Joseph to have diverse sources of income and thus gives his children better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy covers, an irrigation system, tomato plants, organic fertilizers, nylon, and other materials needed to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Duterimbere Cb Sub A Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine is a group leader. She is 40 years old and is married with 5 children, aged 3 to 16 years. They all go to school.

The group is called Duterimbere, which means “let's prosper” in Kinyarwanda. They sell different items, and they wish to expand their businesses in order to earn more profits and have a better future.

Alphonsine owns a shop and has been running this business for the past 5 years. With the loan the group has requested, she would like to use her portion to buy more rice, beans and maize flour to sell. With the profits from her business, she would like to be able to make some savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Twizerane Cb Sub Group A

texts.en:
Angelique, 35, is married and has three school-going children aged between seven and sixteen years. For the past year she has also been the leader of this group named Twizerane, which means “Let's Trust Each Other” in English.

These group members all sell different kinds of items and are working to change their lives. Angelique has applied for a 6,200,000 RWF loan through Kiva's field partner Urwego to be apportioned among her group’s members.

For the past nineteen years Angelique has sold mobile phones to earn an income. With her share of this loan she will buy more phones and their accessories to sell. The profits from her business will be used to improve the family’s standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more phones and their accessories to sell.

loans.name: Duterimbere Cb Sub Group

texts.en:
Sylver is a group leader. He is 29 years old and is not married. The group is called Duterimbere Cb Sub Group which means “let's prosper” in Kinyarwanda.

The group members sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses in order to earn more profits and have a better future.

Sylver owns a shop and has been running his business for the past 5 years. With his loan portion, he would like to buy more items to sell such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, and different kinds of soap. With the profits from his business, he would like to be able to make some savings.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice, sugar, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna, de 41 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, tienen 8 hijos, pero solo 4 viven con ellos y 3 están estudiando.

Mirna, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pues este fue el oficio que le enseño su papá; pero aparte de eso también ha vendido tamales, frescos y panes con su esposo y también compran y venden ganado y cerdos.

Mirna, necesita el préstamo para comprar 4 toretes para repasto.

Mirna, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Mirna, 41 years old, never attended school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture and animal husbandry. They have 8 children, but only 4 of them live with them and 3 are attending school. Mirna has always worked in agriculture, because this was the job her father taught her; but besides that, she also sells tamales and bread with her husband, and they also buy and sell cattle and pigs. Mirna needs the loan to buy 4 young bulls for the grassland. Mirna dreams of seeing her children graduate with a college career.

loans.use: to buy 4 young bulls for the grassland.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Janviere is a group leader, aged 33. The group is called 'Abunzubumwe Group,' which means 'The United' in English. The group sells different products and they wish to expand their business in order to change for a better future.

Janviere sells foodstuffs and she has been running a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize flour, bananas, and cassava to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, bananas, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz, de 32 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la confección gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fábricas donde trabajaba como operaria de máquinas de confección.
Hoy en día es una mujer independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y una pequeña línea propia.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y su motivación más grande para trabajar son sus hijos quienes en algunas ocasiones le ayudan en su negocio.
Ella se dedica a su negocio todos los días durante 5 horas con un empleado.
Ella tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de una auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra de algunos insumos de trabajo como tela, agujas, entre otros.
Con este préstamo ella podrá mantener su actividad vigente y seguirá ofreciendo empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Luz is 32 years old. She has a great deal of experience in dressmaking thanks to multiple jobs in different factories where she worked as a sewing machine operator.
Nowadays she's an independent woman who earns her own profits by providing sewing services to others and making her own small line of clothes.
She's a very enterprising woman and she gets her biggest work motivation from her children who occasionally help her in her business.
She works on her business alongside an employee for five hours a day, everyday.
She has many projects that she wishes to achieve to the extent possible. However, for that to happen she needs the help of some financial support. This will allow her to get working capital for her business through the purchase of some work supplies such as fabric and needles, among other items.
With this loan she'll be able to keep her business afloat and continue to provide employment for people in that industry.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fabric, needles, etc.

loans.name: William Gerardo

texts.es: William tiene 35 años de edad, él está casado, y tiene dos hijos que son su motor de vida, y sus pilares para salir adelante y brindarles las mejores condiciones económicas y sociales para su desarrollo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa USA, de segunda mano. Desde hace 7 años gracias a la liquidación cuando labora en otra empresa. Con  el crédito otorgado invertirá en la compra de 4 pacas mixtas, ropa de niño, blusas y short. Para así tener mayor diversificación y estilos para su clientela.
texts.en: William is 35 years old and married. He has two children who are the driving force in his life and the reason for him to get ahead and provide the best financial and social conditions for their development. He sells secondhand American clothing. He has done this for the past 7 years thanks to the severance he got from the company where he worked. He will use the loan to purchase four bundles of assorted clothing, childrenswear, blouses and shorts. That way he'll have more diversity and styles for his customers.

loans.use: to purchase four bundles of assorted clothing, childrenswear, blouses and shorts.

loans.name: Dufatanye Sub Group B

texts.en:
Odette is a group leader, aged 39. She is married, with eight children aged between two and 20 years. The group is called 'Dufatanye Sub Group B' which means 'work together' in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses, make profits, and have a better future.

Odette sells foodstuffs and she has been running this business for the past six years. With the loan, Odette would like to buy more millet, g-nuts, and beans to sell.

With the profits from the business, she would like to pay for school fees for her children and medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more millet, g-nuts, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco Ana empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.
Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.

Madruga todos los días para trabajar en sus negocio durante 8 horas.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos de confección como tela, hilos y agujas; además desea realizar el mantenimiento preventivo a sus máquinas.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en: Since very early age, Ana learned the job of sewing clothes thanks to her mother, who was a seamstress all her life; and it was this way, that little by little Ana started to understand and apply this knowledge. She is an enterprising and loving woman, who is always ready to help her customers in the best way. She fells very grateful with everything she has been able to build until now with help of  Corporacion Interactuar. She gets up very early every day in order to work in her business for 8 hours. She is requesting a loan to buy sewing inputs, such as fabric, threads and needles; also she wants to do preventive maintenance to her machines. She has much hope in her business, and she keeps the dream of having a much bigger workshop in which she will be able to offer employment and increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing inputs, such as fabric, threads and needles; also to give preventive maintenance to her machines.

loans.name: Dufatanye Sub Group A

texts.en:
Saidat is a group leader. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children, ages 6 and 9. The group is called Dufatanye, which means “work together” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses, make more profit, and have a better future.

Saidat sells fruit. She has been running this business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fruit for resale such as oranges, pineapples, and mangoes. With the profits from the business, she would like to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more oranges, pineapples, and mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 20 años de edad el cual se dedica a vender artículos de papelería, accesorios entre otros productos, un negocio que inició de forma independiente con la intención de financiar sus estudios universitarios y apoyar en los gastos de su familia.
Es un joven soltero sin hijos que tiene como prioridad capacitarse y prepararse para la vida.
El joven actualmente se encentra solicitando un préstamo para abastecer su negocio ya que por la falta de capital no goza de buen surtido y por ende su local no se ve muy atractivo para los transeúntes que diariamente pasan al frente de su empresa.
El dinero será para artículos para la temporada escolar, accesorios y productos de aseo personal.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 20 year old youth who works selling stationary products and accessories amongst other products. He started this business on his own initiative with the goal of financing his university studies and to help with the family expenses.

He is a single young man with no children who's priority is to learn and prepare himself for life.

This youth is currently requesting a loan to stock his business as due to the lack of capital it does not have a good assortment and in the end his business does not seem very attractive to the people who pass by his shop every day.

The money will be used to buy products for the school semester, accessories and personal care products.

loans.use: to buy products for the school year, accessories and personal care products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Good day, Kiva lenders! This is Mary, one of ID Ghana's agents. Mary lives in the chorkor tea gardens of Accra, the capital city of Ghana. She lives there with her husband and two children.

She owns a stall where she sells fresh fish in her community. She joined ID Ghana in 2014. She feels that, since she joined ID Ghana, she has learned a lot about how to improve her business and how to manage another business opportunity, as well as to contribute more to her community.

As the business keeps growing, Mary is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more fresh fish to her community, especially on weekends.

Having known about the importance of her purchase, your loan will be very useful in helping Mary to improve her business and, accordingly, her community who needs such stocks.

As seen in the photo, Mary is the one who is standing with the fish. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more fresh fish to her community, especially on weekends.

loans.name: Dufatanye Subgroup A

texts.en:
Anastasie is a group leader, aged 44. She is married with seven children, aged between five and 19 years.

The group is called 'Dufatanye Sub Group A' which means 'work together' in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses and make more profits in order to have a better future.

The group leader sells clothes and has been running this business for the past 20 years. With the loan, Anastasie would like to buy more clothes to sell.

With the profits from the business, she would like to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en:
This group is called Twisungane, meaning “Help each other” in English. They sell different products and all wish to expand their businesses in order to have a better future. 

Aged 29, Jeaninne is the group leader. She is married with one child who is four years old. She sells clothes and has been running this business for the past two years. With this loan, Jeaninne would like to buy more t-shirts, trousers and skirts for selling.

With the profits from the business, she would like to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts, trousers and skirts for selling.

loans.name: Jhili's Group

texts.en:
Jhili, a differently abled lady standing to the left hand side in the photograph, hails from a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. Jhili and her family's main occupation is cultivation. Her husband is a farmer, and her children are in college. They are able to survive in the cultivation business through their hard work.

But cultivation is a seasonal business, as we all know, and it is not that one gets profits every season of the year. Guess that is why, even seasons are divided as Spring, Summer, Winter, and Autumn. Jhili and her husband want to make the most of it, when they can, and being farmers, they know when to reap and how to sow.

Jhili, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy pesticides, fertilizers, organic manures, and quality seeds.

Their summer days are hard and long. Let her winter nights be warm enough for her and her family. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers, organic manures, and quality seeds.

loans.name: Kalika's Group

texts.en:
A humble resident of a village in Balipatna, Odisha, India, Kalika is standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She is a married lady and a grocer by profession.

Both Kalika and her husband are responsible for meeting the daily household expenses. Kalika is a blessed mother of two sons and a daughter and takes utmost care of her children. She considers herself as a caring mother.

Unfortunately, Kalika does not have access to toilet in her house. For this reason she and her family depend upon the open field for defecation. She finds this practice risky and unsafe as she feels the danger of getting affected by diseases for the unsanitary practices she has adopted.

Therefore, Kalika, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet at her home, so that she no more will have to travel long distances for relieving herself.

Kalika is in dire need of your kind help. Your help could make her lead a better and a disease free life.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet at her home

loans.name: Diogene

texts.en:
Diogene is a 25-year-old, single, hardworking man. He studies at a private, higher level institution called ULK (university). He started his studies in 2014 and plans to graduate in 2018. 

Diogene finds it a challenge to pay the whole amount of his tuition fees at once, but given the opportunity, he would like to pay in installments. He is requesting for a school fees loan for himself.

loans.use: to pay his university fees in installments.

loans.name: Dufatanye Sub Group B

texts.en:
Verediane is 42 years old and a group leader. She is married with six children aged between six and 21 years. 

Her group is called Dufatanye, meaning “work together” in English. The members sell different products and they all wish to expand their businesses, make more profits, and have a better future. 

Verediane sells fruit and has been running this business for the past eight years. With this loan, she would like to buy more fruit, such as sweet bananas, avocados and oranges, for selling. With the profits from the business, she would like to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, such as sweet bananas, avocados and oranges, for selling.

loans.name: Jhuma's Group

texts.en:
The charming lady with a smiling face standing in the middle in the photograph is Jhuma. She hails from an interior village of Balipatna, Odisha, India. Jhuma is a farmer by profession and cultivates green leafy vegetables on her land. She is married and has three daughters in her care.

She is a victim of India's rural sanitation crisis. Having no access to a toilet at her home, Jhuma travels a long distance to dense forests in order to relieve herself. She finds this unsanitary practice dangerous, due to the chance of getting affected by harmful diseases and getting bitten by animals.

To restore her privacy and maintain health and hygiene, Jhuma, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic and clean toilet at her home. The loan amount will ultimately help Jhuma in promoting cleanliness in her community.

Jhuma is in dire need of your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a hygienic and clean toilet at her home.

loans.name: Dukangukirumurimo Sub Group B

texts.en:
Dukangukirumurimo is a group led by Marie Rose who is 37 years old and married with two children, aged three and seven years. 

The group name means “work hard” in English. Marie Rose has been a group leader for the past six months. She owns a retail shop and has been doing this business for the past two years. 

The group members sell different items and they would all like to improve their standards of living. With the loan, Marie Rose would like to buy more biscuits, milk and soda for selling. 

With their profits, they hope to expand their business and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, milk and soda for selling.

loans.name: Dukangukirumurimo Sub Group A Check

texts.en:
Agnes is a group leader. She is 35 years old and single. 

Her group is called Dukangukirumurimo, which means "Let's work hard" in English. The members sell different products and they all wish to expand their businesses in order to improve their standards of living. 

Agnes owns a retail shop and has been running this business for the past five years. With this loan, she would like to buy more sugar, pancakes and juice for selling. With the profits from the business, Agnes would like to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, pancakes and juice for selling.

loans.name: Biswabharati's Group

texts.en:
Biswabharati is a married lady standing to the middle in the photograph. A tailor by profession, she resides in a village of Balipatna, Odisha, India. She hails from a low-income household with access to very limited resources.

Lack of financial resources had never allowed her to build a hygienic toilet at her home and get access to basic sanitary facilities. This has compelled her and her family to walk long distances at odd hours in order to defecate and urinate. This practice is not safe and not feasible enough in the long run.

Therefore, Biswabharati, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well-equipped toilet with a commode and to attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it.The loan will help her in getting access to basic sanitation facilities and thereby improving the health of her family.

Biswabharati is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting for your support.

loans.use: to build a well equipped toilet with a commode and attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it

loans.name: Kanakalata's Group

texts.en:
Kanakalata, standing to the left hand side in the photograph, is a native of a small village in Balipatna, Odisha, India. She is a widow and lives with her two sons and a daughter. The sons are working now and the daughter is still studying.

She well understands the responsibility of a mother and wants to get her daughter married and settled. As she doesn't want her sons to be burdened, she runs her own vegetable shop and makes her living out of it. She wants to expand her vegetable shop and wants to sell a variety of vegetables which will enable her to get more buyers and thus increase her income.

Therefore, Kanakalata, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to procure a great quantity and variety of vegetables from the wholesale market.

Kanakalata is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to procure a greater quantity and variety of vegetables from the wholesale market.

loans.name: Duteraninkunga Cb Group

texts.en:
Duteraninkunga is a group led by Shella, who is 45 years old. The group name translates to "support each other" in English. Shella has been a group leader for the past year. She is a tailor and has been doing this business for the past ten years. 

The group members sell different items and would like to work hard in order to have a better future. 

With the loan, Shella would like to buy another machine for tailoring and fabrics for sale. With the profits from the business, she would like to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy an other machine for tailoring many clothes for sale.

loans.name: Madhusmita's Group

texts.en:
Madhusmita's life story is one we have all heard hundreds of times. Madhusmita has one cow whose milk she sells at the local collection center to earn her monthly income. Being a widow, she now has one son who is 3 years old and has just started going to school. She did not have the luxury of studying beyond the ninth year but she wants to ensure her son gets to study well.

Madhusmita, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to buy one more cow to increase her revenues. An increased amount of milk leads to more sales, which lead to better income--the chain reaction is easy to predict. Providing that initial link is crucial--and it is for that that she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, People's Forum.

Your support would ensure a better livelihood, an educated child, and a dignified existence. That's all it takes really to change the world--one family at a time. Madhusmita is standing to the right hand side in the photograph and is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to increase her revenues

loans.name: Kwifatanya Group

texts.en:
John is a 51-year-old father of six children with three grandchildren. He lives in the surrounding areas of the city. John operates a bar, selling beer, soft drinks and local brew in the same location where he resides. He is a first-time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. (MDI). He has applied for a portion of a 2,500,000 UGX loan to buy stocks of beer, sodas, water and local brew in anticipation of greater sales during the festive season.

The purpose of the loan is to boost his business. He also has a plan of expanding his business. He is grateful for the support rendered to him and has promised to meet his obligations.

loans.use: to boost his pub sales by buying stocks of beer, sodas, water, and local brew.

loans.name: Inezayawe Group

texts.en:
Beathe is a group leader, aged 28. She is married with two children, ages five and seven years old. The group is called Inezayawe, which translated into English means "goodness". The group members sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their lives for the better. 

Beathe owns a shop and she has been running in a business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy shoe polish, Colgate and candles for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy shoe polish, Colgate and candles for resale.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Ana montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposo. 
La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 
Con sus trabajos, Ana ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 
Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Ana busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una maquina recubridora.
Ana espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos.
Además, Ana espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without a lot of capital, Ana opened her sewing workshop with the desire to generate income with which she could support the expenses of the home where she lives with her husband.

She learned the trade taking some courses and this allowed her to carry out work characterized by it's good quality and punctuality in delivery.

Ana has manged to capture a great number of clients with her work which guarantees her good monthly sales. So she hopes her business continues to grow and later she can generate employment for needy people.

With the goal of responding to the demand of her clients, Ana is looking for a loan that will provide her the possibility of being able to buy a cover stitch machine. Ana hopes that in doing this her family will be able to enjoy better income.

Also Ana hopes that her business continues to expand at a good pace and that her shop can generate at least one job for a person who needs it and has no employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a cover stitch machine.

loans.name: Irebero Cb Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a group leader, aged 39. She is married with seven children between the ages of two and 21 years old. The group is called Irebero, which translates into "the focus" in English. Members of the group sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future in positive ways. 

Josephine sells soft drinks and has been running in a business for 18 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soda and juice for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more soda and juice for resale.

loans.name: Luteete Women Group

texts.en:
Winnie Ruth is a 36-year-old mother of three children, of whom two attend school. She is a permanent resident in the nearby surrounding area. She owns a boutique, which she operates, dealing in the sale of new and second-hand clothes.

She is a first-time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. (MDI). She is applying for a portion of a 2,500,000 UGX loan. The main purpose of her loan is to buy stock of clothing for resale during the festive season. Because this is the time when she makes more sales and is able to make greater profits.

She also has a plan of expanding her business by opening up a new branch. She is so grateful for the support rendered to her and has promised to comply accordingly.

Pictured are the group members, with the UGAFODE credit staff member at the far left.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Pratima's Group

texts.en:
Pratima, standing to the left hand side in the photograph, has always seen poverty. She could not study due to lack of funds and societal pressures. Even after marriage, life refused to improve. Her husband’s irregular earnings as a farmer were not sufficient to run the household. But after her divorce, she was determined to provide a better life to her children.

She is involved in the cow-rearing business.The business of cow-rearing appealed to her for a variety of reasons. Importantly, it does not require any new or special skills. She has known how to take care of cattle since childhood. It also did not require any additional space. It could be run out of her own home. Her business took off four years ago and with regular boosts of capital, she now has a stable income from cow-rearing.

Pratima, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She plans to utilize her portion of the loan amount loan amount, plus her own contribution, to buy another cow, doubling her profits. Your help could support her fulfill the dreams she has for her children.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Milagro Isabel

texts.es:
Milagro es una incansable trabajadora de 28 años de edad el cual se dedica a atender un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, le dedica 15 horas días, todo con la ilusión de aumentar sus ganancias para así darle a su familia la cual es conformada por su pareja con quien vive en unión libre y sus dos hijas de 10 y 12 años de edad una excelente calidad de vida y construir un buen futuro.

Su propósito es convertirse en la mejor tendera, una que se destaque pro su servicio al cliente y su buen surtido, trabaja día a día en ese sueño y espera que su negocio siga siendo útil para la comunidad.

Milagro se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con arroz, azúcar, panela, café, pan, papel higiénico, frijoles, lentejas, aceite, huevos, arepas, pastas, chocolate (consumo líquido), papa. Entre otros.
texts.en:
Milagro is a 28-year-old untiring worker who tends a grocery store business. She works 15 hours a day, all with the dream of increasing her earnings to thus give her family, which consists of her partner with whom she lives in free union and their two daughters, ages 10 and 12, an excellent quality of life and to build a good future.

Her intention is to become the best storekeeper, one who stands out for her service to her customers and her good stock. She works day after day with this dream and hopes that her business continues being useful for the community.

Milagro is applying for a loan to stock her business with rice, sugar, raw cane sugar, coffee, bread, toilet paper, beans, lentils, oil, eggs, arepas [filled corn tortillas], pastas, chocolate (liquid for consumption), and potatoes, among other items.

loans.use: to stock her business with rice, sugar, raw cane sugar, coffee, bread, toilet paper, beans, lentils, oil, eggs, arepas [filled corn tortillas], pastas, and chocolate.

loans.name: Umunezero Group

texts.en: Speratha is a group leader. She is 28 years old and is married with one child who is 3 years old. Their group is called Umunezero, which means happiness in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to improve their future. She owns a shop and has been running a business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single woman with a child. She describes herself as goal oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells threads, lining, clothes and cloth. She has been involved in this business for years. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 1600 GHS loan to buy more stock of threads, linings and cloth. This is her seventh loan with ID-Ghana. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of threads, linings and cloth.

loans.name: Ayawa Gbodzidi

texts.fr: Ayawa est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec deux enfants à charge. Ayawa est âgée de 38 ans et est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Ayawa nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice puis pouvoir aussi relancer son activité afin de soutenir au mieux son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Ayawa is a married woman residing in Adidogomé with two dependent children. Ayawa is 38 years old and resells charcoal. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market and sells the charcoal in the front of her home. Ayawa requires this loan to order bags of charcoal with the hopes of making better sales and yielding profits to revive her business in order to support her husband with the family's expenses and provide a good education for her children's.

loans.use: to buy 07 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Alma Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 29 year old woman. She is not married and doesn't have any economic dependents. Although she lives on her own, she likes to contribute to her parents' expenses from time to time. In order to make a living, Paulina works at a local college. She is studying for a doctorate degree at this college.

Paulina recently moved to her flat and she has been fixing small details whenever she has time and money. She has been conditioning it to make it a little more comfortable. She has decided that it is time to change the floor of her flat. To achieve this, she is looking for a loan of 16,843 MXN.

Paulina describes herself as a hardworking person who is dedicated and loves what she does.

loans.use: to fix her flat.

loans.name: Carmen Selene

texts.en:
Carmen Selene is a 22-year-old woman.  She is happily married and has a young son. Her house is provided by her husband, nevertheless she likes to contribute to the household income by making a living. Carmen runs a beauty saloon in which she gives manicures and pedicures, cuts hair, and fixes nails. She also teaches people if they want to learn.

Carmen describes her family as very close; she enjoys spending her free time with them. Carmen's mother-in-law is sick and is now in the need of a surgery.  To pay for it, she is asking for a 21,053.00 MXN  loan that will help her to pay the hospital bill and move past this harsh time.

loans.use: to pay for her mother-in-law's surgery.

loans.name: Doris Elpidia

texts.es:
Doris es de la ciudad de Medellín, se dedica al comercio hace 14 años, es separada, y con la ayuda de su madre se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya es muy conocida en el sector donde ubica su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de elementos de belleza a través de catálogos y a la preparación de alimentos.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y tener una vida llena de éxitos y triunfos.

Pide este préstamo para la compra de surtido de insumos y materias primas para perfumería y comidas rápidas de manera a que pueda mejorar sus ingresos por medio de su trabajo y puede ir aumentando su negocio de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Doris is from the city of Medellín. She has worked in commerce for 14 years. She is separated, and with the help of her mother she has paved the way, and now she is very well known in the sector where her business is located.

She sells beauty products by catalog and prepares food.

She is a very hard-working and striving person who wants to get ahead and have a life full of successes and triumphs.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a stock of supplies and basic materials for perfumery and for preparing fast food so that she can improve her income through this work and can continue expanding her business in the best manner.

loans.use: to buy a stock of ingredients and basic materials for perfumery and fast food so that she can improve her income.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
At the age of 45, Ramatu lives with her partner and four children. She is a hardworking woman and responsible. She seeks to provide her children with everything necessary. She sells used clothing, which provides the necessary income to satisfy her family's basic needs. She also has a small store where she sells basic household items.

Ramatu wants to improve her quality of life and is requesting a loan from Kiva through ID-Ghana to invest in thread, fabric, clasps, pins, used clothes and basic items for her store in order to stock her store and have more material for selling. This way, she will increase her income. She is very grateful for her previous loan. Thanks to it, she was able to sustain her businesses and support her family.

loans.use: to invest in thread, fabric, clasps, pins, used clothes and basic items for her store.

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a 22-year-old woman. She is single, has no children, and lives with her parents. When her family was going through harsh times, she decided to quit school and to do something to help her parents. She took a three-wheeled pedal bicycle and started to sell food on the streets. Not long after that, Leticia and her family managed to move ahead from that situation. Leticia had a business to take care of, and made a considerable profit out of it, but she wanted to get back to school. Currently she works all day Monday to Friday, and attends school on weekends.

Leticia wants to cover a bigger demand, and to do so she needs to increase her stock. To address this goal she is looking for a 7,369 MXN loan. With the money, she would be able to bake more sandwiches, cereals and other kinds of breakfast to offer.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to sell baked goods.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.en:
Luis Enrique is in his early 40s. He is single and has no children. He lives in a house of his own, therefore he has no rent expenses. To earn a living, he runs a cyber cafe that he owns. He started the business not long ago and he has been doing well. He saw his business grow since he only owned two computers.

Now he is looking to make it grow a little bit more by buying a new computer. To do this he is looking for a 7,000 MXN loan. With this, he will earn a larger income and have a bigger business.

loans.use: To buy a new computer for his cyber cafe.

loans.name: Noris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noris es una humilde trabajadora residente en el municipio de Medellín con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Es madre de 3 hijos por los cuales siempre tuvo el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la elaboración y venta de alimentos, estos alimentos los transporta en un carro de comidas.

Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.
De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son las fuertes lluvias y el alto costo de las materias primas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una sombrilla para protegerse de la intemperie.
texts.en:
Noris is a humble, hard-working resident of the municipality of Medellín. Her life is full of dreams, hopes, and the best wishes for her family.

She is the mother of three children for whom she always had the courage and responsibility for making their lives the best.

Now she earns a living making and selling food. She transports these foods in a food cart. She works eight hours a day in her business.

Among the principal difficulties that she must face in her work are the strong rains and the high costs of the primary ingredients.

She is applying for a loan to purchase an umbrella to protect herself from the elements.

loans.use: to buy an umbrella to protect herself from the elements.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 50-year-old woman and a Kubo client. She is single but has a huge family so she is never alone. Sofia loves working as a tailor. Since she was young she always enjoyed dealing with clothes, so she decided to become a professional tailor. She especially likes to make dresses.

Sofia is pictured with a happy customer who is wearing one of Sofia's dresses; the customer is also her niece. Sofia has been in this line of work for more than 30 years. She can repair jeans or even make jeans from scratch (she requires the right cloth). She knows her sales increase in the Christmas season, therefore she is looking to expand the variety of clothes to offer. To get all the materials she needs, she is applying for a 15,000 MXN loan that will allow her to increase her number clients and her income.

loans.use: to buy cloth and materials for her tailor shop

loans.name: Nubia De Jesus

texts.es:
Nubia es una mujer de 50 años de edad, se dedicó inicialmente al negocio de las confecciones en el cual duro tres años como operaria, después de pasar este periodo de tiempo inicio manejando un taller con un amigo el cual le enseño el oficio y la guiaba en todo el proceso para adquirir su propio negocio. 

Es casada y Tiene dos hijos. Hace poco tiempo es una mujer independiente que gracias a los micro créditos tiene la posibilidad de ser su propia jefe y generar un empleo pues su pecera es reconocida por su buen servicio al cliente; solicita el crédito para la compra de tres máquinas; una recubridora , una fileteadora y una plana.

Su principal sueño es tener un taller con muy buena producción, cómodo agradable en el cual pueda encontrar una gran variedad de productos, crecer día a día como empresaria generando empleo y calidad de vida a los seres queridos que la rodean.
texts.en:
Nubia is a 50-year-old woman.  Initially, she made a living as an employee of a dressmaking business for 3 years.  After that period, she started managing a workshop with a friend who taught her the business and guided her through the process of starting her own business.  

She is married and has two children.  She has been an independent woman for a short while and micro loans have made it possible for her to be her own boss and generate employment since her office is known for its good customer service.  She is requesting a loan to buy three machines: a coverstitch machine, a serger, and a flat sewing machine.  

Her main dream is to have a workshop with a good level of production that is comfortable and pleasant, where one can find a great variety of products, and to grow every day as an entrepreneur generating employment and quality of life for her loved ones around her.

loans.use: to buy three machines: a coverstitch machine, a serger, and a flat sewing machine.

loans.name: Christian Ulises

texts.en:
Christian is a 23 year old man. He lives with his mother and has been married to a loving wife for six years. Along with his wife, he raises a young kid whose name is Daniel. This young boy is attending kindergarten. Christian likes to work hard every day so his wife can dedicate her time and attention to the young boy.

To earn a living, Christian runs a restaurant along with his mum. They started this small business seven years ago, and they have been doing well with it. This small restaurant has been providing an income to Christian and his family. Christian claims that his family is the most important thing in his life.

Christian and his mum are looking to expand the business and they both concluded that first they need to create more stock and with it, increase their sales. To do this, Christian is applying for a loan of 10,527 MXN.

Christian's current goals are to keep growing his business and keep his family as close as possible. In the long term, he dreams about owning as many restaurants as possible.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his kitchen.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is applying for a new loan from Kiva to invest in a vast variety and majority of plants, which could allow him to attract more clients and create a higher income. With a higher income he would be able to provide a better life for his children.

Carlos has been making a fair profit out of the last loan he took. He is almost done with the repayment terms of the last one. He is also getting close to his goal of buying another stand in the market.

loans.use: to invest in new merchandise for his stall, to help support his sons.

loans.name: Pedro Rodrigo

texts.es: Don pedro, de 26 años, unido, se dedica al servicio de mototaxi  en su comunidad. Desde hace 4 años con dinero prestado por otras financieras. Para empezar a emprender su negocio, ahora requiere del crédito para 6 unidades de llantas y poder darles mantenimiento para así brindarles un excelente y seguro servicio a sus usuarios.
texts.en: Pedro, 26 years old and single, has made a living through a mototaxi service in his community for the past 4 years with money loaned from other financial institutions.  To start his business, he needs a loan to buy 6 units of tires and to be able to give them maintenance to provide an excellent and secure service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy 6 units of tires.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Desde el año 2010 la señora Maria encontró la fórmula para sentirse útil y poder generar sus propios ingresos y lo logro gracias a la venta de productos por catálogo.

Maria es una responsable, trabajadora y servicial mujer de 29 años de edad que se enorgullece de no tener que pedir dinero a nadie pues ella misma se consigue sustento. 

Solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor y así poder aumentar sus ventas, este es un negocio poco común en su barrio y es por eso que le dedica de 6 a 8 horas a su negocio.

Con tu ayuda Maria podrá mejorar su capital y tener un mejor sustento, apoya hoy!
texts.en:
Since 2010, Maria has found a formula for feeling useful and generating her own income. She achieved this thanks to selling products by catalog.

Maria is a responsible, hardworking and service-minded 29-year-old woman. She's proud of not needing to ask anyone for money because she supports herself.

She's seeking a loan to buy merchandise in bulk to increase her sales. This is an uncommon business in her neighborhood, so she spends six to eight hours a day on her work.

With your help, Maria will be able to increase her capital and have a better livelihood. Support her today!

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jonah has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Jonah requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

Jonah has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jonah would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, spices, school supplies and other groceries.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 29 años de edad, un hombre independiente, soltero que decidió buscar su propio camino, monto un negocio de venta de accesorios económicos para mujeres, tales como bandas para el cabello, diademas, collares, aretes, pendientes.
Luis vive en una zona humilde, las personas frecuenta su negocio debido a la económico de sus artículos y ya que se avecina  la temporada de diciembre busca un apoyo económico para abastecer su tienda con los artículos anteriormente mencionados.
texts.en:
Luis is a 29-year-old, independent, single man who decided to make his own way and start a business selling women's accessories at economical prices, such as hair bands, headbands, necklaces, and earrings.

Luis lives in a humble area. People frequent his store because he sells his items at good prices. Now that the holiday season has arrived he is seeking economic support to stock his store with the aforementioned products.

loans.use: to stock his store with hair bands, headbands, necklaces, and earrings.

loans.name: Juan  Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy alegre, una persona emprendedora que disfruta lo que hace, se dedica a la venta de borojo y piña, dos frutas muy típicas en colombina con excelentes propiedades nutricionales.
Vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene un hijo. Decidió vender estos dos productos debido a que el mercado estaba muy saturado con verduleros y prefirió enfocarse en un solo producto el cual pueda vender al por mayor y que los clientes identifiquen que cuando necesiten piñas y borojo económicos él es el hombre que puede vendérselos.
El cliente solicita un préstamo para abastecerse engrandes cantidades de sus dos productos, espera mejorar sus ventas y lograr buenos contratos de ventas al por mayor en esta temporada de fin de año y seguir ofreciéndole a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a very happy man and an entrepreneurial person who loves what he does. He works selling borojo and pineapples, both which are very typical fruits in Colombia with excellent nutritional properties.

He lives in a civil union with his partner and has one son. He decided to sell these products because the market was saturated with vegetable sellers and he preferred to focus on only one product that he could sell wholesale. This is so that clients know that when they need cheap pineapples and borojos, he is the man who can sell them the produce.

He is requesting a loan to stock up on large quantities of these two products and hopes to improve his sales, establish good wholesale contacts for this season, the end of the year, and continue providing his family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale borjo fruits and pineapples

loans.name: Adjovi Trondina

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Adjovi est une femme célibataire âgée de 28 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Adjovi est une coiffeuse qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché des mèches et tissages et les revendent dans son salon de coiffure. Adjovi nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches et tissages en vue de bien revendre  puis de gagner des bénéfices afin de mieux prendre en charge ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Adjovi is a 28-year old single mother of two who lives in Adidogome. She works as a hairdresser, stocking up on hair extensions and weaves at the market twice a month and the reselling her wares in her beauty salon.  Adjovi needs this loan to order hair extensions and weaves in order to sell them at a good profit margin. Her revenues will allow her to better provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 50 clip-on hair extensions and 30 sets of weaves.

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo café; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Santa Fe de Antioquia.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de café.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is a humble and hard-working farmer with the drive and willpower that characterizes men and women in the countryside. He is a man with an entrepreneurial mind. From a very young age he learned all of the tasks of the country such as farming and raising animals, so much so that today he has his own coffee cultivation. He also sells food in the market in the plaza of the town of Santa Fe de Antioquia.

This person has as a goal to increase and improve the crops that he currently has, and it is for that reason that he has requested the help from a Corporación Interactuar (Kiva Field Partner) loan. He will use the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, and to purchase coffee seeds.

The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as an businessman and as a person, as well as increase his earnings and continue providing for his household. 

He only wants is to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, and to purchase coffee seeds.

loans.name: Pradip Kumar

texts.en:
Pradip Kumar is a 43-year-old, differently abled, married man having a family of three. A resident of a village in Udala of Mayurbhanj district, Odisha, India, he has one son in his care who is studying in 9th grade. Pradip Kumar has a lot of aspirations for his only son and has not kept a single stone unturned to provide the best education to his son.

For the past six years, Pradip Kumar has owned a variety-cum-grocery store near his house. Being the only breadwinner in his house, Pradip Kumar works really hard in order to make ends meet for his family.
