She engages in selling traditional food such as “El majadito de charque”: this is one of the most traditional dishes, prepared with charque (dehydrated meat), rice and fried bananas and cassava, and it can be enjoyed hot or cold. Griselda says, “I cook the majadito together with cassava. This recipe is slowing being abandoned because people prefer junk food. I have troubles selling because of what I lack: I do not have restaurant-like table, but simple ones, and there are plenty of things I lack, we don’t have running water and the place is very hot”. However, her activity is successful because there are few retailers selling traditional food. Her activity takes advantage from the lack of direct competitions; however, she faces a major challenge because of the ingredients she needs to cook on a daily basis. She dreams of being able to pay for the education of her son. She wants to buy ingredients such as oil, rice, noodles, vegetables and meat. In the 2 years she has been selling traditional food, this is the second loan she has asked to the institution.

Griselda is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare and sell traditional food.

loans.use: buy oil, rice, noodles, vegetables and meat to prepare and sell traditional food.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
Jose es un campesino humilde de 27 años de edad, viene de una familia muy trabajadora que se dedicaba a trabajar el campo para ganarse la vida y gracias a los conocimientos que le transmitieron sus familiares hoy en día se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos. Trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana para cuidar y alimentar los animales, los cuales vende por libras o en pie según el requerimiento de sus clientes, que principalmente son propietarios de fincas de la región; de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. 
El titular se caracteriza por ser pujante, activo y trabajador; impulsado por las ganas de seguir progresando, solicita el apoyo de un crédito con el que desea comprar 2 lechones para cría y engorde y desea ampliar aprovechar el espacio que tiene disponible en su corral, en el que adecuara una nueva porqueriza.

Esto le ayudará a aumentar su producción, especialmente para satisfacer la demanda creciente que tiene por la época que se aproxima, en la que sus ventas tienden a incrementar, beneficiando las finanzas familiares. 

Es así como Jose quiere seguir luchando día a día, con empeño y dedicación, pues su ideal es seguir asumiendo la responsabilidad económica de su casa, velar por el bienestar de su esposa y disfrutar junto a ella una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is a simple countryman aged 27. He comes from a very hardworking family who works the land to earn their living. Thanks to the knowledge they have passed on to him, Jose today raises and sells pigs. He starts work in the early hours of the morning caring for and feeding the animals. He sells them either by the pound or the whole animal depending on his customers' requirements, most of whom own farms in the area. In this way Jose earns his living and supports his family.

He is known as a successful man who is active and hardworking. Because he wishes to continue to thrive, he is seeking a loan to buy two suckling pigs to raise and fatten in his corral which has room available. He plans to build a new pigsty. This will help Jose increase production and serve to satisfy the growing demand for pork in the upcoming season. He will make more sales and thus improve his family's financial situation.

Jose wishes to continue working hard and making an effort every day. He wishes to carry on with his role as breadwinner for the household, watching over the wellbeing of his wife, and enjoying with her a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy two suckling pigs to raise and fatten

loans.name: Cristobal Jose

texts.es:
Cristobal, a sus 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de dos hijos.
Actualmente se encuentra dedicado a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, pues tiene el espacio disponible en una pequeña finca y aprovecha que posee conocimientos en la labor gracias a su familia que toda la vida se ha dedicado a las labores agropecuarias. 

Su perseverancia, empeño y las ganas de salir adelante, lo motivan para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará más lechones para cría y engorde, de esta manera podrá continuar con su proyecto productivo con el que espera obtener buenos resultados, especialmente en la temporada de fin de año, en el que aumenta el consumo de esta carne, lo que para el significa generar más ingresos económicos. 

Cristobal desea luchar arduamente para sacar su proyecto adelante y en un futuro sueña con pagar la educación de sus hijos, tener un negocio sostenible con diversidad de productos para ofrecer al mercado y poder garantizar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cristobal, at the age of 23, lives in a free union relationship and is the father of two children.

He now works in raising and selling pigs, since he has space available on a small farm, and he takes advantage of the fact that he has knowledge in this work thanks to his family, which for all his life has done agricultural work.

His perseverance, effort, and will to get ahead motivate him to apply for the support of the loan, with which he will buy more piglets to raise and fatten. In this way he will be able to continue with his profitable project, with which he hopes to obtain good results, especially in the season at the end of the year, in which the consumption of this meat increases, which for him means generating more income.

Cristobal wants to work hard to advance his project, and in the future he dreams of paying for the education of his children, having a sustainable business with a diversity of products to offer to the market, and being able to guarantee a better well-being and quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and fatten.

loans.name: Sindy Johana

texts.es:
Sindy es una mujer solidaria de 25 años de edad que busca a través del Micro-crédito una solución para tener una mejor entrada de dinero suficiente para sostenerse. 

Tiene un pequeño negocio en el que vende ropa, bolsos y accesorios para dama, atiende a sus clientes siempre con un excelente servicio pues sabe que de estos depende la sostenibilidad de su negocio.
Trabaja 5 días a la semana durante 5 horas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de bolsos, pues desea aumentar su capacidad de inventario y así poder afrontar su principal dificultad que es la falta de capital.
texts.en:
Sindy is supportive 25 year old woman. By way of a micro-loan she is looking for a solution to have a better intake of money, enough to sustain herself.

She has a small business where she sells clothing, bags and accessories for women. She always takes care of her clients with excellent service as she knows the sustainability of her business depends on it. She works 5 hours per day, five days a week.

She is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of bags as she wants to increase the capacity of her inventory. Then she can face her principal difficulty, which is the lack of capital.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of bags as she wants to increase the capacity of her inventory.

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
William, de 26 años de edad, está acompañado, estudio hasta quinto grado, junto a su pareja tiene 3 hijos.

Willian, realiza diversas actividades para generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, algunas ocasiones presta servicios de motorista en alcaldía, también cuida ganado en una pequeña finca del cantón, pero lo más importante es que se dedica a producir sus propios alimentos, cultivando maíz, frijol y en épocas siembra algunas hortalizas, es por eso que siempre dispone de alimentos básicos para mantener a su familia.

Willian, necesita el préstamo para pagar la mano de obra para trasladar la cosecha hasta su casa, para luego procesarlas y obtener los beneficios de sus cultivos.

Willian, sueña con obtener buenas producciones y aprovechar un excedente para la venta, también se ha propuesto comprar animales de corral.
texts.en:
William, age 26, is in a common-law marriage. He went to school until 5th grade. Along with his partner, he has three children.

William carries out several businesses in order to generate income to cover his family’s needs. Sometimes, he offers his services as a driver in the municipality. He also takes care of cattle on a small farm in the rural community. But most importantly, he works to produce his own food, growing corn and beans, and at times some vegetables. It is for this reason that he always has basic foods available to support his family.

William needs the loan to pay for labor to move the crop to his house, in order to then process it and reap the benefits of his crops.

William dreams of having good production and making use of the excess it for sales. He has also decided to buy some farmyard animals.

loans.use: to pay for labor to move his harvest to his house, in order to then process it and reap the benefits of his crops.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 49 years old, lives in her own home with her life partner. She has worked making and selling tortillas for 15 years. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. She manages to cover some of the household costs with the earnings she obtains from her sales. 

She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the hundredweight and lime, in order to continue making tortillas. She will then be able to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the hundredweight and lime.

loans.name: La Amistad De Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Elicia tiene 51 años de edad es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace varios años. Y a la vez expende cosméticos a través de catálogos. De esa manera puede mejorar su encomia.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para su negocio arroz azúcar aceite verduras tubérculos al por mayor. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el brindado.  Elicia es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Elicia is 51 years old. She is single with grown children. She has sold food for several years and at the same time she sells cosmetics through catalogues. She can improve her economic situation in that way. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her business: wholesale rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, and tubers. The group thanks the KIVA lenders for the support given. Elicia is the first one on the left side.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, and tubers

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es: Martha de 41 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en donde ha vivido desde hace 16 años. Vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 8, 16, 20 y 21 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, ha instalado un negocio de crianza y venta de gallinas, el cual tiene varios años de administrar. Su vivienda es humilde y ha sido construida con láminas y madera que con el paso del tiempo se han deteriorado y lo que les dificulta tener tranquilidad en su hogar, más que todo por las lluvias tan fuertes que caen. Es por esto que Martha solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos, madera y pago de mano de obra para mejorar la vivienda. De esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y poder tener mayor tranquilidad.
texts.en: Martha, 41 years old, lives in her own house, where she has lived for the past 16 years. She lives with her life partner and her kids, who are 8, 16, 20 and 21 years old.  She is a very enterprising woman; to satisfy the basic needs of her family, she started a business breeding and selling chickens, which she has been managing for several years.  Her house is humble and is made with metal sheeting and wood that has deteriorated over time, which makes it difficult for them to live in peace in their home, mostly because the rain is very strong. For this reason, Martha is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheeting, nails, wood, and labor to improve the house. In this way she will improve her quality of life and by able to live in peace.

loans.use: To invest in: sheeting, nails, wood and labor to improve the house

loans.name: Sonia Irbela

texts.es:
Sonia, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 15 años de edad que estudia noveno grado. 

Sonia, se dedica a trabajar en una pupusería, desde temprana edad se dedica a esta actividad y la distancia que recorre para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo es de 1 kilómetro diario y el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m. Pero aparte de eso quiere iniciar con un nuevo negocio de venta de ropa, porque en esta época de fin de año se vende bastante.

Sonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 docenas de camisas, 2 docenas de pantalones y también ropa interior para niños. 

Sonia, sueña con ver a su hija prepararse académicamente y mejorar los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 34 years old, and she studied through the fourth grade. She is a single mother and has a 15-year-old daughter that is studying in the ninth grade.

Sonia works at a pupusa shop. From an early age she has been working in this occupation and the distance she travels to get to work in one kilometer each day. Her work schedule is from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm. Apart from this he wants to start a new business for the sale of clothes because the end of the year is when they sell the best. Sonia is requesting a loan to buy two dozen shirts, two dozen pants, and also underwear for children. Sonia dreams about seeing her daughter progress academically, and improving her family's income.

loans.use: to buy two dozen shirts, two dozen pants, and also underwear for children.

loans.name: Flor Pacaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR PACAYA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa para bebé, venta de leche, servicio de transporte, venta de helados, tienda de barrio, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para bebé; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por una necesidad económica por la que atravesaba.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa para bebé por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece la señora Marlene ya que después del desembolso tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Flor Pacaya is a Communal Bank that will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. It is composed of eight members, guided by a directive board< Marcela is their secretary. The member of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as selling baby clothes, selling milk, providing transportation services, selling ice-creams, running a general store, selling shoes and selling clothes.

Marcela is one of the micro entrepreneurs of this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. She says that she has become a member of Pro Mujer for the first time through the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She is currently engaged in selling baby clothes, and she says she has learned how to work in this field man y years ago, because she was facing economic difficulties.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying baby clothes at wholesale price. She will buy them from the wholesaler of the town of El Alto, to then sell them in the markets of El Alto. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her family, as she is single and as two children.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes seminars provided by the institution.

Marlene is not included in the picture because she had to go to her stall and work immediately after having received her credit.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes at wholesale price.

loans.name: Yahea

texts.en:
Yahea is 40-year-old man from Gaza City. Hhe is married and father of one little son. Yahea was living with his family in a small humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza, his house was destroyed completely, so he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Yahea took a USD loan from Palestine for credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his former house. The loan will allow Yahea to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.
Yahea appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his former house, destroyed by war

loans.name: Marylyne

texts.en:
Marylyne is a 36 years old supporting 8 people in her family, she sells clothes, a business she has been doing for the last 14 years and gets a monthly income of Kes 10000.

She has applied for her first loan with Visionfund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for sale

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
María, considera que si no fuera por el buen uso de los créditos y las ganancias su negocio no continuaría en el mercado, la atención que brinda a sus clientes en la peluquería es mucho mejor, sus ingresos son estables y el estilo de vida que comparte con su familia es más confortable.
Por la facilidad de pago y apoyo que recibe, ha decidido seguir trabajando con créditos en Padecomsm, lo piensa utilizar en la compra de nuevas máquinas para cortar pelo, talcos, peines, y geles para el cabello, pretende tener siempre surtido su negocio para cuando sus clientes necesiten de su servicio.
texts.en:
María believes that if it was not for the good use of loans and the earnings from her work she could not continue in business. The attention that she gives her customers at the barber shop is much better. Her income is stable and the lifestyle she shares with her family is more comfortable.

Because of the ease of loan payments and the help she receives from Padecomsm she has decided to continue working with them. She is thinking of investing in the purchase of new hair clippers, powders, combs, and hair gels. She intends to always have her business stocked when her customers need her service.

loans.use: to buy new hair clippers, powders, combs, and hair gels so her business will always be stocked when her customers need her service.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a personal care products business in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of personal care products to sell.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 45 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school, Ma. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, bread and other personal care products.

Ma. Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Ma. Lourdes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Nelby Isabel

texts.es:
Nelby es una campesina trabajadora y humilde, con 39 años de edad, sigue trabajando para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus 3 hijos. 

Durante 12 años se ha dedicado a la cría y comercialización de cerdos y ganado de levante, actividad que aprendió por herencia familiar y que le ha permitido generar recursos para salir adelante.

Actualmente solicita un crédito con el que desea comprar cerdos, materiales para adecuación de corrales, concentrado para alimentar a sus animales y lograr tener una mejor producción que le permita generar mayor nivel de rentabilidad a la hora de vender.

Nelby manifiesta que los problemas no son impedimento para seguir realizando la labor que lo apasiona y que le ha dado de comer durante toda su vida, por ello sigue luchando incansablemente para lograr incrementar su ganado porcino y de levante y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecer a sus hijos menores la oportunidad de tener una educación de excelente calidad para que sean unos profesionales íntegros y exitosos.
texts.en:
Nelby is a hardworking and humble farmer. She is 39 years old and continues working to meet her family's basic expenses. She is married and has three children.

She has worked raising and selling pigs and young cattle for 12 years. She learned this work from her family and it has allowed her to generate income to move forward.

She is currently requesting a loan to purchase pigs, materials to repair her corrals, and feed for the animals, so that she can have better production, which will allow her to generate more profits when she makes a sale.

Nelby says that problems are not an impediment to continuing to do the work you are passionate about and has fed you throughout your life. She continues fighting without rest to successfully fatten her pigs and cattle so she can improve her family's quality of life and offer her young children the opportunity of having an excellent quality education so they can become upstanding, successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, materials to make corral repairs, and feed for the animals so she can have better production.

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.en:
Maria is just 18 years old and lives in the municipality of San Carlos, with a little daughter who only is 4 years old and loves her more than anything. It hasn’t been easy for this young woman who became a mother really young, but it pushed her to work hard for her daughter. She started to sell clothes last year.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy inputs for this season like t-shirts and skirts. She’s aware that this Christmas season is a great opportunity to sell a lot, so she hopes that with this investment she can improve her sales. She dreams with buying her own house so she can live safe and comfortable with her little daughter.

Maria is a young girl but a strong woman who needs a little help, and a loan will do a lot for her.

loans.use: buy inputs for this season like t-shirts and skirts

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo perseverante porque se esfuerza mucho para alcanzar sus metas, ella con el crédito pudo realizar  más productos para su negocio de papas y a sus clientes logro satisfacer mejor y una carreta nueva compro, por esa razón ella está muy agradecida  con los inversionistas. Afortunadamente Claudia en su negocio le ha ido muy bien por eso considera necesario una nueva inversión para seguir prestando un buen servicio, ella solicita en esta oportunidad  Q 5,000.00 para comprar papas, aceite, pollo y harina. Con esta inversión espera poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y tener un local propio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is a very hard working and especially perseverant woman, because she makes a lot of effort to reach her goals.

With her loan, she was able to make more products for her potato business, managed to better satisfy her clients, and bought a new cart. For those reasons, she is very thankful to the investors.

Fortunately, Claudia has been doing very well in her business. Because of this, she considers it necessary to make a new investment in order to continue providing good service. In this opportunity, she is requesting 5,000 GTQ to buy potatoes, oil, chicken, and flour. With this investment, she hopes to be able to continue growing her business and have her own stall for her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her business, such as: potatoes, oil, chicken, and flour.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.en:
Martha is 47 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. She has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter, she loves them with all her heart and they are the motor of her life. She has been working for many years to provide for them in a business that she started 13 years ago, she makes beautiful traditional art craft.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some materials she needs like “mostacilla checa” (a traditional Colombian material), threads and elastics to make her crafts. She expects that this investment will increase her production. She dreams with paying for her children education so they can grow up and be professionals. 

You can be part of Martha´s story, help her with the loan she needs, and watch her succeed.

loans.use: buy some materials she needs like “mostacilla checa” (a traditional Colombian material), threads and elastics to make her crafts

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 38 years old and lives in the municipality of Mariquita. She has two dearly loved sons who are 14 and 8 years of age. In order to provide better for her family, last years she decided to start a business, she raises pigs to sell later, but now she wants to make it bigger.

She’s asking for a loan so she can make some reforms to the pigsty and to buy pigs and food for them. She wants to invest in her business so it gives her better profits and can make it sustainable. She dreams with paying for her sons’ education, because she believes that education is the best tool to succeed in life.

Help Magdalena now with the loan she needs and watch her improve her business and her life.

loans.use: make some reforms to the pigsty and to buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Pajomel Group

texts.es:
María es una joven de 22 años de edad es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Sololá.
María (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) es una joven con grandes sueños y propósito en la vida, lleva 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de papas y pollo frito, este negocio está ubicado en una de las principales calles de su comunidad, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica.
María  gracias a su amabilidad y buena preparación de su producto, tiene mucha demanda y con el afán de mejorar su calidad de servicio hacia sus clientes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más productos como papa, aceite, harina y pollo.
Con esta inversión espera  abastecer mejor a sus clientes y fortalecer su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a young woman of 22. She is unmarried and lives with her parenttts and siblings in a village in Sololá.
María (first on the left in the photo) has big dreams and a purpose in life. She has been selling potatoes and fried chicken for two years. Her business is on one of the main streets in her community, but she brings in additional income by making traditional clothing.
Thanks to her kindness and the high quality of her product, María’s business is quite popular. Hoping to improve the service she offers her customers, she has decided to apply for a loan to purchase more products such as potatoes, oil, flour, and chicken.
She hopes that this investment will allow her to cater to her customers better and strengthen her business so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: purchase products for her business such as potatoes, oil, flour, and chicken.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean is village chief of Prosat Village living with wife and 4 children. As a village chief, he needs to work a lot of paper work which some time can take her night time. Beside village chief work, he does farming and grows lotus. Sean has difficulty on using a battery as he has to go to charge the car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day.

As a result, he decided to apply for Kiva loan. He believes solar home system can help his family reduce utility cost and improve his working hour at night.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Prosat Village, Da Commune, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 45 years old, married and the mother of five children, four of whom are currently in school. She earns a living by selling rice in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Editha has been in this business for three years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from poultry. Elsie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials for her business, such as fish net and gasoline for her boat, and to pay for maintenance.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business, such as fish net and gasoline for her boat, and to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es:
Dagoberto es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

Él tiene un cultivo de plátano y yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Valencia.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

Él solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.
 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores de Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Dagoberto is a veteran with much experience in the country. He is humble, simple, with a great gift with people and enough energy to produce any crop.

He grows plantains and yucca which he works on every day and sells his harvests in the plaza of the municipal market of Valencia.

Thanks to his years of experience and what his father taught him since he was a boy, he has full capacity to work and to advise other farmers in the area on these matters who need help with their production.

The loan he is requesting is to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, plantain seeds and pesticides. In this way he will inject capital into his business and improve his crops in a significant manner facing the biggest difficulty he has which is the changing climate and it's effect on his crops.

He has great faith in his business and great hope in the supportive people who help the working farmers of Colombia as the Corporación Interactuar does.

Support a humble farmer with a loan so he can get ahead with his land!

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, plantain seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Yolber Javier

texts.es:
Yolber es un hombre de 34 años de edad, padre de 4 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental. 

Actualmente trabaja en la cría de peces, para lo cual cuenta con el espacio que hay disponible en la finca en la que vive y trabaja. 

Por esta razón solicita el crédito para invertirlo en comprar peces cachama y el cuido y alimento para los animales; así podrá aumentar la producción y comenzará a incursionar en un mercado más amplio, lo que le permitirá mejorar los ingresos familiares para sustentar todas las necesidades del hogar. 

Yolber manifiesta que su principal meta es velar por el bienestar de su familia y auto sustentarse, para generar mayor rentabilidad en su negocio y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolber is 34 years old and lives with his four children and common-law wife. He currently works raising fish, and has space available on the farm where he lives and works for them.

He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of cachama fish, and to care for and feed them so he will be able to increase his production and move into a wider market. This will allow him to improve his family's income to meet all of the household necessities.

Yolber says that his main goal is to watch over his family's well-being, be self-sustaining, and generate more profit from his business so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cachama fish and feed for them.

loans.name: Lengie

texts.en:
Lengie is 42 years old and married, with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lengie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Lengie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.en: Sandra is 45 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pedro de Uraba. She has two children, a son and a daughter, and started a sales business five years ago to help her boyfriend and father of her children to provide for their family. She started this business with the help of her mother in law. Sandra has a lot of dreams regarding her business, including opening a store, creating new jobs and having a big selection of items for customers to buy. She’s aware of the need to invest in the business so it can get better, and wants to increase her clients and profits, which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy clothes, shoes, bed sheets and other items to sell during this Christmas season.  Her goal for the future is to save enough money for her children to have a good education so they can succeed.

loans.use: buy some clothes, shoes, bed sheets and other items to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.name: Pabla Isabel

texts.es:
Pabla con gran determinación un día decidió independizarse de su empleo y montar su propio negocio con el cual pudiese recibir mayores ingresos por el servicio prestado, pues en su empleo anterior sentía que su trabajo era muy mal remunerado. 

Pabla se encuentra casada y junto con su esposo han formado un gran hogar donde ella aporta económicamente a través de su negocio de pollos y alimentos. 

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos para cría, insumos para preparación de alimentos y utensilios de cocina.

Pabla espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo al ritmo que ha venido haciéndose, y así seguir generando ingresos con los cuales pueda aportar económicamente en su hogar.
texts.en:
With great determination, Pabla decided one day to become independent from her employer and start her own business, so she could receive more income for the service provided. Her previous employer did not pay well.

Pabla is married and together with her husband, they have built a great household. She contributes financially through her chicken and food business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase chickens to raise, ingredients to prepare food, and cooking utensils.

Pabla hopes that this will help her business to continue to grow at the same pace as it has been, so she can continue generating income that will support her household financially.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise, ingredients to prepare foods, and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for nine years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Gina is requesting another loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is 42 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Lalaine has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. 

Lalaine requested a loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en:
When the Zimbabwean government restricted poultry imports, it was a welcome opportunity for small scale chicken farmers in Zimbabwe. Many individuals started or extended their poultry businesses. This led to an increase in the need for poultry feed. The broiler chickens need a specialised diet in the six weeks of growth. Whilst many were building fowl runs and buying feeders for their day old chicks, Temptations decided to be the neighbourhood “feed warehouse” where different types of chicken feed plus the required medicines are found.

She started buying chicken feed for resale around her neighbourhood in Budiriro in Harare. This was a welcome innovation by many chicken farmers as it brought chicken feed right to their doorsteps. Temptations recently joined Progress group, a group which is one of Thrive’s oldest and most loyal clients. The group now consists of 5 members. For Temptation this is a first loan which she wants to use well under the guidance of the older, mature members in her group. She also attended training sessions and got business advice that she feels will help her in growing her business.

Every week, twenty seven year old Temptation hires a pickup truck to go and restock chicken feed. These weekly transport costs reduce her profit margins hence the need to restock once or twice a month in bulk thereby saving on transport costs. She wants to use her loan to buy many bags of feed for resale as the demand for chicken feed in her neighbourhood and surrounding places has increased.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed in bulk for her wholesale business to save costs.

loans.name: Zaida Estela

texts.en:
Zaida is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pedro de Uraba. She has a son who is only four years old and she feels that he’s the greatest present in her life. When she got pregnant, she decided that she needed to start a business, so she could provide for him. So, she started a pig-raising business.

Zaida's parents taught her everything that she needed to know, so she became an expert. Now, she wants to take her business to a new level -- she wants to increase the profits and the number of clients.

Zaida’s asking for a loan, so she can buy food for her pigs and do some improvements to the pigsty.

Zaida dreams of buying a house for herself and her son, so they can live safely and better. She also wants to give him the best education she can.

You can be part of Zaida’s life. Help her improve her business and her life with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs and do some improvements to the pigsty.

loans.name: Nazirkhoja

texts.en:
This is Nazirkhoja who lives in the district of Qurgan-tube. Nazirkhoja is 27 years old, married and a father of one child. From his childhood he was a very hardworking boy and always helped to his parents.

Nazirkhoja is engaged in the transportation business as a taxi driver. He has his own car, but as he said this car is already old and needs for repairing but it takes a lot of money. For this reason he decided to take a loan and repair his car. He believes with this car his possibilities will increase and he will be able to expand his activity.

In the future Nazirkhoja has more perfect plans; one on them it is to buy a new car and expand his activity. With you support and help, Nazirkhoja believes in his better future.

loans.use: to repair his car that he uses as a taxi

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 51-year-old married mother of one, who opened in 2009 a clothes selling shop to support her husband in covering their living expenses and developing their living.
Fatima is a hard working business woman, who puts so much effort to please her customers.
Fatima's income combined with her husband's limited monthly salary, are barely enough to cover their increasing living needs.

Thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special winter collection and will be a response to her customers' needs.
Fatima will work hard to keep on developing her business as much as she can to fulfill her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special winter collection and respond to her customers' needs.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 24 years old and single with one child. Mary Rose works very hard to provide for her child.

Mary Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, bread and other personal care products.

Mary Rose has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Mary Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a housewife and a working woman aged 37 and is the mother of seven children residing in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her son is running a shoe factory from which he generates a reasonable amount of money, and he uses it to contribute to the family and also save an amount for himself.

Now he is well experienced with the machinery and wants to buy the raw materials so that he gets better profits and increases his living. Therefore Tasleem, his mother, has applied for the loan amount of 40,000 PKR so that her son could buy the required raw materials. Further she is thankful to the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her son's shoe factory.

loans.name: Willian De Jesus

texts.en:
William is 43 years old and has two children. He lives in the municipality of Caicedo. He is a farmer, growing different products, which he has been doing for eight years. 

William requested a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizer for coffee plants. He hopes the coffee will grow bigger and with better quality, so his clients can be satisfied. He hopes to pay for a good education for his children and to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his coffee plants

loans.name: Sutë

texts.en:
In the background is Sute's so-called 'house' and she is holding her sister's son who is been scheduled for a surgery. She is very poor according to the national poverty level.

Sute, a 50-year-old widowed mother of two for 26 years, has been practicing agriculture/livestock for the past twenty five years. She owns only two dynym agricultural land where she plants only veggies and other things for the family's consumption and also fodder for her animals. She also has two dairy cows and also a pig and 14 chickens, yet she only sells raw milk and baby calves to the local farmer's market in their own nearby town. Her 27-year-old son who still lives with her, works for a pay of $307/month.

"When my husband died, I was pregnant with the younger son, who is now 25 years old. My life became difficult. I never made it to live like majority of others in the villages around. I had to raise two children, but God was there for me to guide me all these years," said Sute.

Sute needs your compassion to help her financially so that she pays for her sister's son scheduled surgery and also buy some other needed things for her sons.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's son surgery and also buy some other things for her two sons

loans.name: Maria Dilamar

texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and lives in the municipality of Sonson. She has four children, who are the reason for her hard work and motivation. Two years ago she decided to start her own business. She raises pigs, something she does to solve the economic issues of her family and provide for all her children.

She is asking for a loan so she can buy pigs and improve her pigsty. She hopes it will help her increase her profits so she can support her family better. She dreams of improving the conditions of her house so they can have a better quality of life.

You can be part of Maria's story. Please lend now.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to improve her pigsty.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman who is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and kids in the municipality of San Vicente Ferrer, place where she has a farm where she grows different kind of products and has been working for around 15 years. This business was inherited from her family, and to honor them, she wants to make it successful. 

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy agricultural inputs and materials for the farm maintenance. For the support of her family, she expects that her business can last in time. She wants to improve the conditions of her house that are not in their best.

Maria needs a little help so she can improve her business and can accomplish her dreams, loan now.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and materials for the farm maintenance

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Sarorn is a nurse in Toul Samrong Village living with husband and 2 children. As a nurse, she needs to work evening shift some time. She always has a concern about her family safety when she is not at home since her family is using a car battery for power, a source that has acid substance. Moreover, she has to go to charge car battery every day for daily usage. It is a time and money consuming activity. As a nurse, she doesn't have time to charge the battery and most of the time end up staying in pitch black.

Therefore, Sarorn decided to apply for Kiva in order to buy a solar home system. After using solar home system she will be happy. Her family also can live in a convenient condition with bright light.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Toul Samrong Village, Kraing Skea Commune,Toek Pho

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 28-year-old married Palestinian man who started repairing cars 8 years ago in order to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Sami is an ambitious man and a hard worker who has a good reputation in his region. He is trying desperately to develop his business, thus, today, he is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. He plans to buy electrical spare parts to better serve his customers. Sami hopes to further develop his business in the future so he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy electrical spare parts to better serve his customers

loans.name: Rodelo

texts.en:
Rodelo, 37, is a married man with three school-aged children. Together with his family, he lives in Baclayon, Bohol. He engages in selling home-cooked meals like pansit (noodles), sauteed vegetables, fried fish, and other native foods. He has been engaged in this kind of business for more than five years. 

He has requested a loan to buy supplies for food vending and to pay for school fees. With these, Rodelo will be able to prepare a variety of home-cooked meals, which he could sell to the locals in his place. 

Thus, his earnings will improve and he will be able to handle his finances. He would be able to provide his family with good food and better shelter to live.

With his previous loan, Rodelo was able to repay it back successfully and now he is requesting a new loan to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food vending and pay for school fees

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 39-year-old married. She is a fish vendor from the town of Sierra Bullones. She lives in her own home with her three children, two of them are still attending school. 
Her husband also has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.
She has been a fish vendor for more than 5 years now.

She has insufficient funds to purchase higher volume of fish, to cope with demands. Therefore, Cecilia is asking for a loan  to purchase a variety of fish. These are very vital to her day to day living. Thus, her income will augment and she will be able to continue to provide for the needs of her family.

Cecilia is thankful to Kiva for the continued support, and in return she is doing her best to continue  to seek ways to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Haghartsin village in Armenia. There she both farms and breeds cattle. Because her husband is a migrant worker, her son is involved in a retail business and her daughter-in-law takes care of her two children, she must manage the family’s farm mostly by herself.

Hasmik has applied for a 700 USD loan through Kiva's field partner SEF International to pay for customer clearance of an agro machine to use on the farm. This loan will be very helpful for her work on the farm.

loans.use: to pay for custom clearance of an agro machine (truck) to use on the farm for transporting the harvest

loans.name: Green Ladies Group

texts.en:
One cannot choose how and when someone you are close to should die but one can only choose how you will live afterwards. Mary (39) of the Green ladies group is a widow, mother of 5; the passing away of her husband did not shatter her dreams to see her children have a high quality education and live a good life.

Mary has been financing her children’s tuition through her business of selling second hand clothes at ‘mupedzanhamo’, a local market. Mary has been in the business of buying and selling clothes since 1998. She buys the second hand clothes in neighbouring countries such as Mozambique and sells them back home in Zimbabwe. Mary has two tables which she operates from. However, lack of adequate capital was hindering her to grow her business to its fullest potential. She was operating six tables before but her capital depleted after her husband died with whom she was partnering.

Mary came to know about Thrive microfinance through a friend and decided to join in October 2015. They were very eager to learn about financial literacy and business management through training offered at Thrive as well as the prospect of receiving a loan.

With a loan from, Mary hopes to unlock her business’ fullest potential by restocking more clothes from Mozambique and open up more selling tables as she used to have before.

loans.use: by restocking more clothes from Mozambique and opening up more tables as she used to have before.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir, a Palestinian man, lives with his family in a refugee camp located in North Lebanon. He is 45 years old, and he and his wife have five children, two daughters and three sons. Samir's wife is not employed, and she takes care of the children and the house.

Samir is a taxi driver, and he used to work in a taxi company for 26 years. After saving the money he needed, he started working in his own car in 2007, which allowed him to cut out renting costs and increase his profits. With all his years of experience, Samir has built himself a very good reputation in the camp, as he is very reliable and punctual.

For the first time, Samir is asking for a 2,827,056 LBP loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs to buy a new car, and to rent out the one he is currently using in order to be able to serve more clients and increase his income.

Samir is an ambitious man, and he works inside and outside the camp whenever he has the opportunity. He is only concern is to provide better living conditions for his wife and kids.

loans.use: to buy a new car and rent out the one he is currently using.

loans.name: Clementino

texts.en:
This loan of $ 1000 will allow Clementino to go to University. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies.

Clementino is very happy because Tuba Rai Metin offered to improve his education for his future.

loans.use: To buy tuition, textbooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Mrs. Hien is 42 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection.

Husbandry, cultivation and fishing are main income source of her family, so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activities and selling fish, which her husband caught.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Vaavaai

texts.en: Vaavaai is 29 years old, married and the mother of four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy cooking oil, a bag of flour, baking powder, tongs, a frying pan and other items. In the future, Vaavaai hopes to extend her business and better support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a bag of flour, baking powder, tongs, a frying pan, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en: As the married parent of five children, Jelly works hard to support her family by running a fishing business in the Philippines. She supplements her income by raising poultry, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to  buy fishing supplies such as a net and gasoline for her boat. She successfully repaid seven previous loans and is requesting this new one to further build up her businesses. Jelly hopes that hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as a net and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Jesaly

texts.en:
Jesaly works hard to support her family. She is married with two children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jesaly requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and to pay for fishing expenses.

Jesaly has been in this business for six years now, and earns additional income from fattening pigs.

In the future, Jesaly would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and to pay for fishing expenses

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and has four children, all of whom are in school. She is married.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilyn has been farming vegetables for eight years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 28 years old and lives in the municipality of Sonson. Recently, she inherited a business from her family, and it is her mission to keep with it and make it successful. She raises cattle, something she learned thanks to her father, who taught her everything.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy two dairy cows. She expects that this investment will let her help her business to continue and become recognized in her municipality. She dreams of improving the conditions of her house so her family can have a good quality of life.

Help Maribel now with a loan and watch her succeed.

loans.use: buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Yony Joel

texts.en: Yony is 40 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pedro de Uraba with his three sons and one daughter. His family is the most important thing in his life, and the reason why he works hard at raising pigs business, something his brother taught him to do. The pigsty where he has his animals is in bad shape and the materials he needs to fix it are expensive. He wants to improve his sales by attracting new clients and earning greater profits. He has requested this loan to buy the supplies and tools he needs to provide his livestock with a better place to live. Yony dreams of providing his children with a good education so they can be professionals. This man is looking for a little support to accomplish big things, and with this loan you can help him reach his goals.

loans.use: buy the materials and tools he needs to fix his pigsty.

loans.name: 7 Rosas Y 1 Clavel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “7 ROSAS Y 1 CLAVEL” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chamarras, venta de repuestos para movilidad, venta de instrumentos de viento, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de pizza. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de un asesor que es parte dela institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en otro país trabajando como costurera y cuando retorno al país, decide emprender su propio taller de costura de chamarra, quien le apoya en este negocio es su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera de Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "7 Rosas y 1 Clavel" Group (meaning 7 roses and 1 carnation), will start its twenty-ninth cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal Collpani.  It is directed by a board of directors with Cristina as its president.  The business activities of the members of this communal association are varied.  Among others, they sell: jackets, spare vehicle parts, wind instruments, clothing, blankets, groceries, and pizza.  

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen like Cristina.  She points out that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation from as adviser who is a part of the institution.  Presently, she has a dressmaking business and she sells jackets.  She learned the business in a different country while working as a seamstress and when she returned to the country, she decided to start her own workshop for sewing jackets.  Her husband supports her business.   

The loan that she will take out now will be a part of an increase in capital.  She will buy fabric from the wholesale vendors from the border of Peru and Bolivia and later the produce the garments and sell them from her point of sale.  This kind of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health department and the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 54 years old, married and has four children.

Nancy is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Nancy requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTFto buy feed and other supplies with which to raise her pigs.

Nancy has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies with which to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking female entrepreneur with six children.

She has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines, and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal for resale.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like fattening pigs.

Dolores dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Chila

texts.en:
Chila works hard to support her parents. She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Chila requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like fishing nets, gasoline for her boat, and other materials.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Chila has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Chila would like to save enough money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like fishing nets, gasoline for her boat, and other materials.

loans.name: Julie Andrea

texts.en:
Julie is 25 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Salgar. She has always dreamed of being a successful woman, and she works hard to accomplish that goal. Two years ago she started her own business: she sells different products, like clothes and accessories. The business is something that she started to meet her economic needs.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy merchandise like jeans, blouses, perfume, and women's bags for resale this Christmas season. She expects that this investment will help her to be more competitive in the market and will help her business to continue in the future. 

She wants to improve the conditions of her house.

You can help Julie to accomplish all her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like jeans, blouses, perfume, and women's bags for resale this Christmas season.

loans.name: Arcelio

texts.en:
Arcelio is 63 years old and lives in the municipality of Turbo. He has three children, whom he loves very much and of whom he feels very proud. They helped him to start his own business so the family could have a better life. He has a farm, where he grows many different products, something he inherited from his family.

He’s asking for a loan so he can buy seeds to grow plantain, to pay for some workers and to buy fertilizers and other agricultural materials. He expects that with this loan, he’s going to improve his sales, and the profits will increase. He dreams of someday leaving a successful business to his children and to give to his family a good quality of life.

You can help Arcelio to accomplish all his dreams with a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow plantain, to pay for some workers and to buy fertilizers and other agricultural materials.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Roeun is a 59-year-old married homemaker with a dependent child. She lives in a village in the province of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a 57-year-old construction worker. Together, they can make approximately 6 USD each day. She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, Roeun will be able to improve the family’s finances. For her future plans, Roeun is going to run a grocery store and build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Sarona

texts.en:
Sarona is 47 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business, selling pancakes in her community, and has been doing this for two years. 

Sarona has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, etc., for her business. She joined SPBD in 2014, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sarona will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Faateaina

texts.en: Faateaina is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She would like to start a small business painting and selling clothes in her community to earn a living. In order to do this, Faateaina needs a loan to buy a printing board, material, paints, sponges, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She has been a member of SPBD since November 2015.

loans.use: to buy a printing board, material, paints, sponges, etc.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a hardworking female entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell at her store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Rosalia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from running a general store. Marilou is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc., for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc., for her food vending business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 52 years old, married, and has five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Pacita has been farming vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Seke 3 High Group

texts.en:
The Seke 3 high ladies have proved that they are a force to be reckoned with when it comes to business. Their group was the first to be given a loan in May 2015 when Thrive opened new offices in Chitungwiza. After six months, the group is back for their second loan. All members have grown their businesses and were able to repay their loan effortlessly.

When group member Puranat joined Thrive, she was a vendor selling vegetables and fruits for more than two years. She would brave the early morning chill and go get fresh vegetables and fruits at reasonable prices from the farmers. She is a married mother of three young children.

Now Puranat has diversified to selling maize. Maize makes “sadza”; which is Zimbabwe’s staple food. Therefore, there is always a readily available market for maize. She is able to sell at least 2 tonnes of maize in a week. Puranat’s quality of life has since improved; thanks to profits from her previous loan she was able to buy sofas for her home in addition to paying school fees for her children.

With her loan, she is now planning to increase her maize stock. She hopes to buy a truck which can make her business easier and increase her profit levels.

loans.use: to increase her maize stock. She hopes to buy a truck so that she can make her own deliveries.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria, sin contar con mucho capital pero manteniendo las ganas de salir adelante que siempre la han caracterizado, se vio en la obligación de encontrar una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera aportar económicamente al sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Gracias a que una amiga le enseñó cómo trabajar el negocio, Maria decidió montar una venta de ropa y productos de uso personal desde su casa donde tiene una vitrina para exhibirlos y gracias a esto ha podido generar ingresos extras con los que su hogar ha podido tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Por la buena atención que ofrece y la buena calidad de sus productos, Maria ha captado un gran número de clientes que le garantizan muy buenas ventas en su negocio, a tal punto que la necesidad de capital se vuelve una dificultad constante para poder responder a los grandes pedidos que hacen sus clientes. 

Con el ánimo de poder comprar mercancía para su negocio, busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de más ropa al por mayor y productos de uso personal con los cuales pueda responder a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

Maria espera que con esta compra de la mercancía siga respondiendo a los pedidos que le hacen y pueda seguir aumentando su capital para que su negocio siga creciendo cada vez más.
texts.en:
Maria, without being able to depend on much capital but maintaining the desire to move forwards that people have always noticed about her, finds herself obligated to look for a source of income that will allow her to support her household economically.  

Thanks to a friend who taught her how to run a business, Maria decided to start a business selling clothing and personal-use products from her home, where she has a window to display her goods.   Thanks to the business, she has been able to bring in extra income that allows her to have a better quality of life.  

Because of her excellent customer service and the good quality of her products, Maria has captured the attention of a great number of customers that guarantee her good sales in her business, to such an extent that her lack of capital has become a constant obstacle in her efforts to respond to the large orders that her customers place with her.  

With the intention of buying merchandise for her business, she is seeking a loan to provide her with the possibility of gaining access to more wholesale clothing and personal-use products that she will use to fill her customers' orders. 

Maria hopes that this purchase of merchandise will allow her to continue responding to the demands that her customers make and be able to continue increasing her capital so that her business continues to grow more and more each time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Naroth

texts.en:
Naroth is an 18-year-old single student, who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Accounting at university. She lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Her father is a teacher and her mother is a rice farmer.

Due to the fact that Naroth is short of the money to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year, she would like to secure a loan. With this loan, she will graduate successfully. For her future plans after graduation, Naroth is going to renovate the family house.

loans.use: to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year, for a BA in Accountancy

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Fifty-two -year old Edgar raises poultry. He raises native chickens and sells them to the town dwellers locally. He is a single man and has been raising poultry for one and a half year now.

He would like to raise quality poultry, but he has insufficient funds to make it. That is why he join Kiva's field partner CEVI to take a loan.

Edgar has requested a loan to to invest in feed . This is very vital in his business. Thus, able to produce high quality poultry, and his earnings will goes high. He could now start to save and the revenues will be use to continue expand his poultry business to become successful.

Edgar is thankful to Kiva for its support.

loans.use: to invest in feed

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Batasan, Philippines. A 25 years old business woman currently engaged in a buy and sell business of different ready-to-wear clothes. She’s earning around Php 15, 000 each month and selling those items in the market in their community. She has a child in school that’s why she’s striving for the business’ success to support the school expenses and other expenditures. 

Anna doesn’t have any employees to watch over the business, it’s just her managing it. She’s a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and tried to apply for a loan of Php 30,000 as she’s planning to buy bulk quantity of ready-to-wear clothing to sell in preparation for this coming holiday season. Aside from clothes, Anna also sells varieties of bags and other stuff she could think of stocking her store.

She believes that CCT helps her on the business since aside on the monetary provision, they also do seminars and lectures for new entrepreneurs as part of the program where she can acquire new ideas and marketing strategies for the business.

Anna has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantity of ready-to-wear clothing to sell in preparation for this coming holiday season. .

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fattening pigs.

Ailyn dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sophoung

texts.en:
Sophoung is a factory worker in a near by area with husband and 2 children at Chhoung Preal Village. Beside her factory work, she helps her husband to do farming and feeding the pigs. She wants his children to be highly educated at least bachelor degree; however, her family is living in a remote area without power grid.

As a result, She is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality solar home systems for her family safety and her future goal. Her children will be able to study at night time better than before. Her whole family also can live in a safer environment.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Chhoung Preal Village, Toek Hot Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Amira Leonor

texts.es:
Amira es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos. 
Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de acolchados; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su familia. 
Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Amira is a 49-year-old married woman who is married with three children.  Presently, she makes a living selling quilts.  She started the business with the support of a family member, and she has been able to bring in income to support her household.  She has an entrepreneurial and fighting spirit, and she has the desire to move forwards to continue with her business.  

She wants to use the loan that she is requesting from Interactuar to buy a supply of merchandise so that she will have the opportunity to increase her sales by offering a larger variety of products that will satisfy the diverse tastes and requirements of her customers, who are principally friends and neighbors.  

Her main goal is to have a large supply and to expand her portfolio for her good customers and increase her sales, which will allow her to increase her wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a supply of merchandise.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be social. She operates a poultry farm where she keeps chicken. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more poultry. She hopes that in the future, she will be a millionaire. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 63 years old, married with three children.
