Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell to her store such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, eggs, snack foods etc.

Mae has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Mae aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell to her store such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, eggs, snack foods etc.

loans.name: Baltyrkan

texts.ru: Балтыркан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 8 овец, лошадь, на 2,06 Га земли она выращивает арбузы и хлопок. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Балтыркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Балтыркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство сараев.
texts.en:
Baltyrkan successfully repaid her loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with her financing.

Today, Baltyrkan's farm has 4 cows, 8 sheep, and a horse. She grows watermelon and cotton on 2.06 hectares of land. Her monthly combined income is around 25,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, Baltyrkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Baltyrkan plans to use the income from her loan to continue increasing her number of domestic livestock, and plans to save funds for the construction of a barn.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock.

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Марина, 41 год, замужем, есть сын -школьник. У Марины среднее образование, у нее большой послужной список, начала свою карьеру Марина в качестве повара, потом торговала продуктами питания, была мойщиком посуды в кафе, сейчас работает уборщицей в школе, также занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Марины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 1,23 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации оптовым покупателям. Также в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 10 овец.  Ежемесячный доход Марины составляет 24,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 14 овец. Доходы от кредита Марина планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Marina is 41 years old, married, and has a son in grade school. Marina has a secondary-level education, and she has a very long resume. She began her career as a cook, then sold groceries; she has been a dishwasher at a cafe, and she now works as a janitor at a school. Meanwhile, she also does field and animal husbandry work.

Thanks to Marina's very hard work and purposefulness, she now has a plot of her own land measuring 1.23 hectares, where she grows beans that she sells to wholesale buyers. Her farm also has 3 cows and 10 sheep. Marina's monthly income is 24,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy 2 cows and 14 sheep. Marina plans to use the income from her loan to continue developing her business and build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase 14 sheep and two cows to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with eight children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows potatoes, maize, beans and other crops.

She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challengeis inadequate working capital.

This is Ruth's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future she will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ama Afranchi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 34 ans, Ama  est une femme qui vit avec trois enfants à charge. Habitant à Adidogomè, Ama prépare et vend de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » puis du charbon de bois et le revend à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Ama s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire. Pour commander le sac de maïs et des sacs de charbon de bois, Ama demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat afin de gagner plus de revenus pour pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir aux charges de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ama is 34 years old, married and has three dependent children. She lives in Adidogome. Ama cooks polenta-like cornmeal dish known as "Akpan" for sale. She also sells charcoal in front of her house in order to increase her profits. Ama stocks up at the market twice a month. 

Ama is requesting this loan to pay for a bag of corn and some bags of charcoal, so as to earn more revenues and help her husband provide for their children.

loans.use: to buy one bag of corn and five bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Элмиры среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Элмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 16 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Elmira is 36 years old, married, and is raising 3 children with her husband. Elmira has a secondary-level education, and as the primary income source for her family, she raises animals. She began doing this 3 years ago, when she bought livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Elmira's very hard work, her farm now has 16 sheep. Her monthly income is around 13,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, Elmira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. Elmira plans to use the income from her loan to continue increasing her quantity of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy one cow.

loans.name: Elde

texts.en:
Elde is a married man living in Dimiao, Bohol. He is a father to five children, three of whom are still dependents aged 15, 17 and 19. 

Elde works hard driving his motorcycle to transport passengers to places not usually catered by bus. This type of service is known locally as "habal-habal". Aside from this business, he also raises hogs to earn additional income. 

Since raising hogs entails waiting for four months, Elde is asking for a loan to buy feed for his pigs. He hopes to make his business more profitable so that he can better provide for his family out of the income that he will get in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with four children ranging in age from three years to 17 years. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, cooking fat, and other items.

He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is transportation costs.

This is John's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more milk, soap, bread, cooking fat, and other items to sell.

John will use the anticipated profits to replenish his stock. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more milk, soap, bread, cooking fat, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has five children.

She operates a retail business where she sells soda, sugar, cereals, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are locals.

Esther will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of cereals, soda, soap, flour, and other items.

She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereals, soda, soap, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as being focused.

He operates a retail business where he sells stationery and offers photocopy services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are students. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

Peter will use the KES 99,000 loan to buy more stocks of stationery. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business.

This is Peter's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were successfully repaid. He will use the anticipated profits to open other business branches.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of stationery.

loans.name: Naisula

texts.en: Naisula is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells soft drinks, bread, airtime and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes. 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soft drinks, airtime and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soft drinks, airtime and other items.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is a married man with two children. He describes himself as humble. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes.

He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a potential area and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is low stock.

This is Johnstone's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy more clothing to sell.

Johnstone will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lais Maria

texts.es:
Lais, en su mente lo único que tiene presente es que para salir adelante hay que trabajar duramente y mantenerse siempre fuerte ante las adversidades que se puedan presentar.

Por esta razón, todos los días labora de una manera firme pero sin dejar a un lado su gran sonrisa y carisma que le han permitido ganarse un lugar desde hace 10 años cuando decidió abrir su negocio de comidas en el municipio de Sincelejo.

En su negocio ofrece alimentos variados, los cuales son muy apetecidos por los clientes que visitan regularmente su negocio.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de un carrito de comidas y surtido de insumos como carne y harina.

Ella sabe que de la mano de interactuar y con el apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA podrá tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y con la mejor estabilidad posible.
texts.en:
In Lais's mind, the only thing she could think about was that in order to get ahead, she would have to work hard and always remain strong in the face of adversities that might present themselves.
.
For that reason, every day Lais labored in a firm manner, but without losing her grand smile and the charisma that has allowed her to gain a place for herself during the last 10 years, since her decision to open a meals business in the municipality of Sincelejo.

In her business, she offers a variety of foods which are very appetizing to the customers who regularly visit her stand.

Lais is requesting economic aid to purchase a little food cart and a selection of supplies such as meat and wheat.

Ella sabe que de la mano de interactuar y con el apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA podrá tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y con la mejor estabilidad posible.
She knows that in the hands of Interactuar, and with the help of Kiva lenders, she will be able to have a well-supported business with the greatest possible stability.

loans.use: purchase a meal cart and a selection of supplies such as meat and wheat.

loans.name: Una Luz Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es: Zorayda tiene 45 años de edad es conviviente con tres hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescados sobre pedidos hace más de un años.  Años atrás se dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más pescados para poder atender todos sus pedidos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Zorayda es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Zorayda is 45 years old and lives with her partner and three dependent children. She has been making a living selling fish upon request for more than a year. Years ago she was dedicated to her home. 

She will invest the loan in buying more fish to be able to attend all her orders. 

The group thanks KIVA investors for the loan provided. Zorayda is the first woman on the right in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with three children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells earrings, necklaces, bangles, and other items.

He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Peter's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 60,000 loan to buy more earrings, bangles, and necklaces to sell.

Peter will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more earrings, bangles, and necklaces to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de prodcutos con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su hijo, su madre y sus dos sobrinos, ella esta solicitando un credito para comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman has her face blurred because she is 27-years old and lives in a dangerous area. She has had a small shop located in her place of residence for two years and has many customers for the variety of products. With the earnings she makes from her sales, she is able to settle some of her household bills. This young woman lives in her own house with her son, her mother and her two nephews.

She is requesting the loan to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, candies, pastries, etc. to be able to improve her income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, candies, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man with four children. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are locals.

This is Charles' first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy barber shop equipment and will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. He hopes that in the future he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a Kiva borrower. He has four children. He describes himself as polite. He operates a retail business where he makes baskets.

He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Albert's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan and will use this KES 60,000 loan to buy materials for making baskets.

loans.use: to buy materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Alizbath

texts.en:
Alizbath is a 55-year-old widow woman. She has two children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years she has been running a cloth purchase and sale business.

She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

Alizbath expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 40-year-old married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of fabrics at low prices from a city market and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Gulshan has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business and to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business and to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Osnaider

texts.en:
Osnaider is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello in Colombia. He’s a man who has worked hard to provide for his family. Two years ago he started work as a barber, a profession that he learned by himself and is very talented in. He works around ten hours a day, seven days a week; he’s really committed to seeing his business succeed.

Osnaider has applied for a 1,500,000 COP loan through Kiva's field partner Interactuar to buy a barber’s chair, a TV and paint to improve his shop. He believes that the comfort of his place is a big part of the attraction for new clients, so it will help him if he upgrades his place of business. In the future, he hopes to accomplish a big dream: to buy a house for his family so they can have a better quality of life.

Help Osnaider to do great things with his business and his life. A loan would help him very much.

loans.use: to buy a barber’s chair, a TV and paint to improve his shop.

loans.name: Erica Alejandra

texts.en:
Erica is 26 years old and has has one child. She lives in the municipality of Medellín. She operates a furniture upholstery business, which she has been doing for five years. She inherited the business from her family and learned from her father.

Erica requested a loan, which she will use to buy fabrics, foam, glues, and wood. She expects that this investment will let her increase the number of clients and improve her sales, but the most important thing is that it will make the business more competitive in the market. She dreams of buying a house where she and her daughter can have an fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, foam, glues, and wood

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita earns a living via her vegetable vending business. She sells vegetables like squash, carrots, eggplant, beans, and green leafy vegetables. She has been selling vegetables for quite a period of time, serving locals and nearby residents in her community.

She is a 59-year-old married woman and has seven children, of whom two are still attending school.

She has requested a loan to buy additional vegetables to sell. These additions will fill her display and attract potential customers. Her earnings will increase and she will continue to manage her business to help it become more sustainable.

Teresita hopes that her business will be more productive, and she thanks Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 62 years old and married with four children. For the past nine years she has operated a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Noeme has taken out and successfully repaid previous loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 20,000 loan to buy additional groceries to sell in her shop. She is always working hard to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family’s home.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen, is 28 years old and a married man, lives in a remote village of BATTAMBANG Province. Sen and his spouse help each other in farming activities in order to put the family in better living conditions. He has been engaged in this field nearly 5 years. Both of them can earn the average income is USD 10 per day.

At the moment, Sen would like to buy solar panels to install at his home. This solar will help him and his family with light at night. They also can use radio or TV for their entertainment. Due to the shortage of funds, Sen has requested a loan from Kiva to buy a set of solar home system.

He is very happy and thankful to all lenders and also awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a set of solar home system

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en:
Jovencio live in the rural town of Tolosa, Leyte . He runs a sari-sari(variety) store, selling various commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods.
He is 62 year old married man with five grown children.

He would like to augment his livelihood but as of these time, he needs funds to stock up his store.

Jovencio has requested a loan from CEVI in order to purchase rice and invests in electronic top-up load. In that way, his income will augment and enables to cater the daily needs of his household.

In the future, he would like to expand his business and to engage in a rice retailing business to have a stable source of income in preparation of the old age.

loans.use: to purchase rice and invest in electronic top-up loads.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old. She is a widow with 2 children of 25 and 14 years respectively.

She has had a dairy business for 5 years, currently earning monthly income of KES. 30,000. She has borrowed KES. 100,000 as her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, after repaying the previous loan successfully.

With the loan, Mary will be able to purchase feeds for her dairy cattle.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established business and enjoy a better live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 68 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, and bread, as well as shampoo and other personal care products.

Nilda has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, and bread, as well as shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Nadgie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nadgie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Nadgie is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Nadgie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to realize her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 20 years and she is married. She has one child. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and so she is applying for her second loan of USD 600. She will buy grilled fish and rice. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy grilled fish and rice.

loans.name: Quynh

texts.en:
Mrs. Quynh is a hardworking woman, 52 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard.

Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry, cultivation and fishing. With more than 20 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 52, mother of two grow up children. She lives in Aghavnatun village of Armavire region with her elderly retired parents-in-law, husband and two chidlren.
Tamara has been involved in farming since she was young. With the help of her all family members, Tamara keeps livestock of oxen and cows, and cultivate greens, cabbage, potato and beans in the yard.
All these foods Tamara sells both locally and at the local wholesale market. Family owns greenhouse as well, but it is old and needs some investment.

The requested loan will greatly help Tamara and her family to improve the greenhouse and make cultivation of vegetables in winter season also. Tamara asks lenders to support her to purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and wires for improving it.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and wires for improving it

loans.name: Lavdije

texts.en:
Lavdije is being photographed in the veranda of her house and she is a married mother of two. Her annual income of $1500 comes from selling baby calves, dried beans, potatoes, corn and wheat. She also receives a disability income of $133/month plus some social assistance of $25/month.

Lavdije owns about 8 dynym agricultural land where she plants wheat in 3 dynym and in the rest she plants corn, beans, potatoes and seasonal veggies. She's got also some orchards such as pomegranates, plumes, persimmons, quince, apples and grapevines.

All what she wants to do with this loan, is making repairs to the rundown home. "It started leaking already inside and I have to use buckets. Not only is the roofing old and the ceiling leaking, but it also brings so much cold inside from doors and windows that have never been replaced now since the house was built, about 50 years ago. And this loan will help me immensely improve our living conditions," said Lavdije to the loan officer who disbursed her.

loans.use: to improve living conditions; make some basic repairs to the 50-year-old home that was never had any work on it since built.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 59 years old married to Everline and blessed with four children aged between 20 years and 12 years old.

He has been into dairy and tea farming business for fifteen years and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 45,000.

This being his third loan with VisionFund Kenya,he intends to do some farm developments by renovating his cow sheds as well as to purchase fertilizers and dairy feeds.

From the anticipated business profits,he intends to pay back the loan, provide water by installation and provide basic education to his children.

His hopes are to settle down after retirment by engaging in large scale farming.

loans.use: to do farm developments by renovating his cow sheds also purchase fertilizers and  dairy feeds.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia wants to earn income while at home.  She’s grateful as Center for Community Transformation (CCT) helped her monetarily by approving her previous loan amount of Php 35, 000 and for all of the lenders as well. The amount made her buy additional computer unit as she dreams of expanding her internet café- resulting in bigger income each day.

Emelia is persevering to have better savings. She’s determined to step-up on the industry and obtain more patrons is what she aims on the business. She decided to apply for a loan of Php 30, 000 that she’ll use as an added capital. She’ll buy another set of computer and other peripherals. More computers means bigger earnings.

Emelia believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional computer units needed for her business.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Then through loans from Kashf Foundation Ayesha has initiated her business of hand embroidery. She is 55 years old, a married woman, with 4 children. Ayesha is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand.

She has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Ayesha closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers, to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 35 years old and a married woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Roselyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Roselyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has one child still in school.

Josefina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is from Logucan, Maria, Siquijor. He is 51 years of age. He and his partner have adult age children. He joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. From his desire to help the family, he engaged in selling fish in different barangays in municipality of Logucan, Maria. Only his motorcycle was used as his source of transportation to reached the different barangays and sell fish. His source of income existed for 20 years now.

In need of additional working capital, he requested a financial assistance from Paglaum MPC an amount of Php 50,000.00 to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, he hopes to increase and/or has more income for he is able to provide for the daily needs of his family and also he is happy he can support the education of his children which is his main priority of his hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 41-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married with five children; they are 15, 14, 8, 6 and 4 years old. Her husband is a welder while Maria helps her husband in doing this livelihood. They have been doing this for five years to raise their children.

Thus, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy welding materials. In the future, Maria wants to be successful in her business for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en:
Vagharshak is 38, farmer living in Aragats village. His only occupation is in land cultivation, growing vegetables like cabbage, greens, potato, beans and tomato. Vagharshak owns a greenhouse, but because of it is damaged, he cultivates currently only in the open.

The reason Vagharshak applied for this loan is to improve the greenhouse and continue farming in winter season as well. He plans to purchase polyethylene cover and wires for the renovation and improvement of the greenhouse and also potato seeds for cultivation.

Vagharshak lives with his wife, 11-years-old son and elderly retired mother.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene cover and wires for the renovation and improvement of his greenhouse and potato seeds.

loans.name: Gasarara Group

texts.fr:
J. Claude fait partie du groupe  Gasarara et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 28 ans et est marié à Odette. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 à 7 ans,  dont 1 étudie.
 
Il fait le commerce des œufs  depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’œufs  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  avoir une boutique  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Claude is a part of the Gasarara Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 28 years old and is married to Odette. Together, they have three children between the ages of two and seven, one of whom is in school.

He has been selling eggs for six years.

He is on his second loan with Turame. With the loan he receives from Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy many eggs to resell to make a larger income.

In the coming years, he would like to have a shop and see his children in school.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy many eggs to resell.

loans.name: Beqir

texts.en: Beqir who is photographed with his goats wants to add some more to the existing herd and this is the reason of this loan.

loans.use: to add 20 more goats to the existing herd

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 46-year-old married woman living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. She is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

She has been running an embroidery business for 15 years to meet the family’s expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the colony, and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relations, her business has increased. She is a brave woman.

Asia buys materials such as a hand-embroidery kit, ribbons, needles, and an embroidery machine from the market. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. Another person handles her transactions with her customers.

Asia has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She requested a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

She wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why she wants to buy threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours in advance, to have in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Asia humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy the threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours that she needs.

Asia and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.
.

loans.use: To buy embroidery raw material for herself

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez , 61 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Kaneez  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 60000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Financial constraints, alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her eight children, are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged our Shameem to start her business selling animals by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Shameem is 50 years old; she is a married woman. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: Shomaila

texts.en:
Shomaila is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. She is a responsible to fulfil the needs of the entire family. She has been running her embroidery business for three years to meet the family’s expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the colony, and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relations, her business has increased. She is a brave woman.

Shomaila buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbons, needles, and an embroidery machine from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. So, Shomaila requested a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

She wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why she wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours in advance, to have in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Shomaila humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy the thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours that she needs.
Shomaila and her family will be thankful to KIVA lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials such as  thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours that she needs for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Ma. Sisa

texts.en:
Ma. Sisa is a resident in the town of Tolosa. She earns a living running a sari-sari(variety) store and sells merchandise such as noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods.
Aside from that she also runs a bakery. She sold bread and pastries, as means of supplemental income to its household. She is married woman and has three young children. She would like to filled her store with variety of supplies to cater its demands. She decided to join CEVI to avail loan.

Ma. Sisa has requested a loan to purchase soft drinks and frozen goods. In that way, she will be able to serve her respective clients well. Thus, enabling her daily income to improve.

In the future, Ma.Sisa is aiming to have a healthy family and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and frozen goods like longaniza( sausage) and hotdog

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 49 years old married to Robert and blessed with three children aged between 15 years and 8 years old.

She has been into dairy farming and milk business for nine years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.28,000.

This being her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya,she intends to buy a dairy cow as well as dairy feeds.

She anticipates to pay back the loan and save for future borrowing. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a zero grazing unit for higher milk production.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow as well as dairy feeds

loans.name: Jury

texts.en:
Jury is a married woman who is 46 years old, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, and other materials for her food production business.

Jury has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Karen dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a married woman, 44 years old, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a "buy-and-sell" banana business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Valentina has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Surrounded with poor financial circumstances, Razia needed to start her own business to increase her purchasing power to meet her household expenditures financially.

Razia is 37 years old, a married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community.

She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stitching materials, such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials, such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc., to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old and lives in the municipality of Fredonia. Four years ago, he inherited the family business, raising chickens. His parents started teaching him how to run it when he was a little kid, and now he’s an expert at it. He wants to make his business bigger for the well-being of his family.

He’s asking for a loan so that he can buy more chickens and food for them, in order to have more to offer. He expects that with this loan, he can get more profits, get more clients, be more competitive, and make the business last for a long time. He dreams of buying a house where his family can live happily.

Help Carlos to accomplish his dreams with this loan he´s needing.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and food for them so he has more to offer.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a father of 4 children aged 44, living in a small area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He is the only bread winner for the family. He owns a business of beauty products and jewelry sales. He contributes his income for household expenses. He always tries to establish his business through offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are very demanded and may be expensive as well.

Therefore Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He will use the full amount to invest in his business so that he can buy latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish and also jewelry etc. He hopes that through this amount, he will be empowered to enhance his business.

Ali is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: restock with more artificial jewelry and cosmetics for selling.

loans.name: Yolima Maria

texts.es:
Yolima es una determinante, imparable y simpática mujer, que sin importar las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida, tanto económicas, familiares y labores, inicio con un negocio de comidas que opera en la calle en un carrito de comidas.
Tiene diferentes inconvenientes, pero básicamente es el clima, por esto solicita un crédito para la compra de una carpa para proteger su negocio de la intemperie.

De este modo podrá crecer con un negocio fuerte y estable que compite con los demás restaurantes de la zona.
texts.en:
Yolima is a determined, unstoppable and nice woman who, despite the adversities that life has brought to her, not only financial, but also family and work related, started a food business which she manages on the street in a food cart.

It has several drawbacks, but, essentially, it's the weather. That's why she requests a loan to buy a tent to protect her business from the elements. This way she will be able to grow with a strong and stable business which competes with the other restaurants in the area.

loans.use: to buy a tent to protect her business from the elements.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 54-year-old married woman; she is involved in the business of selling stitching materials to support her family. She offers different laces, ribbons, threads, and buttons in different colors.

She has become popular in her street for providing good material to her customers. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase lace, buttons, and spools of threads in different colors. It will improve her earnings and enable her to better support the needs of the family members.

loans.use: to purchase lace, buttons, and spools of threads in different colors

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be out going. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows peas, tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy farm inputs and a cow. His business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will excel in business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and a cow

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
Elvera is one of the community partners of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She was granted a loan amount of Php 50,000 and able to use the amount for her variety store business. She’s grateful as CCT and lenders helped her a lot in the business by means of the monetary support. The amount was used in buying stocks of grocery items for her variety store business.

Aside from her variety store, Elvera is also managing her own junk shop business. She’s aiming to invest for a house and lot and currently saving money for her family. That’s why she’s contemplating of ways on how to increase the business’ revenue. However, added capital and revolving fund will help her to make the businesses flourish. With this, an amount of Php 50,000 is what she applies. She’ll use the amount for buying large quantity of scrap items daily such as plastic, steel, broken glass and such for the Junk Shop while the remaining will be used for buying grocery items for her variety store.

On a weekly basis, Elvera regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy large quantity of scrap items daily for her junk shop business with the remaining amount for buying grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a restaurant in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like a general store. Ann dreams of one day being able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he grows crops and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy crop seeds for planting and animal feeds. His business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy crop seeds for planting and animal feeds.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca considered Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all of the lenders participating in the Kiva program as God’s medium of blessing. She’s pleased of having CCT since they approved the previous loan amount of P20, 000. And that amount has been a supplementary capital for her business’ growth. She was able to buy necessary items for the business to become more attractive to customers.

Competition on this line of business is what challenges her. Proper marketing strategy and well treatment to customers are the qualities that she has. She’s thankful that for 10 years of having the business and until now it’s continually growing. She’s still hopeful that her dream of having her own house and lot will still take place by faith.

She believes that an entrepreneur should always think of ways on how to step-up. That’s why she applied for another loan amount of Php 25, 000 as she wants her business to be a one-stop-shop someday. She’s hoping that her request will be granted as an added capital for the business.

Rebecca has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s blessed that her previous loan of Php 20, 000 was granted which was used as an additional capital for the business. Sincerest appreciation she wants to send for all of the lenders who extended help financially.

Carmelita aims to have a one one-stop-shop where she can offer products on demand and complete items and attract more patrons. However, late payments can’t be avoided. To compensate, Carmelita applied for a loan of Php 25, 000. She’ll add stocks of items such as: bottled drinks, school supplies and other grocery items, that’s she believes will be the start of the business growth.

Carmelita regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Shabeeran Zafar

texts.en:
Shabeeran is a 58year-old widow living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She is a responsible to fulfil the needs of the entire family. She has been running an embroidery business 20 years ago to meet the family’s expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the area and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relations her business has increased. She is brave woman.

Shabeeran buys materials such as Hand- Embroidery kit, ribbons, needles and embroidery machine from market. Another person handles her transactions with her customer and she has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family.

She wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why she wants to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colours in advance, to have in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Shabeeran humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy all that she needs.
Shabeeran and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping her by funding this loan to improve her living standard.
.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for herself for decorating bridal dresses

loans.name: Huzaifa

texts.en:
Huzaifa is in his 28's, resident in Rawalpindi,Pakistan, is well known and is a respected man, who is living with family and his two children. The clothing business is a family business which his father started 11 years ago and Huzaifa started working there at a very young age.

However now he wants to grow his business by investing a little amount in and from that amount buying the stock which is in most demand these days. Therefore Huzaifa applied for the loan so that he gets help with his business.

Huzaifa appreciates the efforts put in by the Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: invest in his clothing business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently, and to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices.

loans.name: Zunilda Rosa

texts.es:
Un pequeño puesto de venta de comidas fue lo que con mucho esfuerzo logro esta emprendedora mijer de 38 años de edad llamada Zunilda, que buscando una alternativa para generar ingresos tuvo la idea de montar su negocio. 

Hoy en día por la inseguridad y violencia que se presenta en el sector, su negocio está viéndose afectado, pues están alejando sus clientes en estos tiempos de crisis. 

Solicita una ayuda crediticia con la Corporación Interactuar para tener capital de trabajo para invertirlo sabiamente en esta época difícil, comprando insumos para la preparación de tamales, además de comprar también zapatos y ropa al por mayor y vender.

Espera lograr superar esta crisis y gozar en un futuro al lado de su esposo y sus hijos
texts.en:
A small food stall was what, with much effort, this entrepreneurial woman of 38 years of age, named Zunilda, was able to accomplish. As she was looking for an alternative to generate income, she had the idea of starting her business.

Nowadays, due to the lack of safety and the violence experienced in this area, her business is being affected, as they are driving off her clients in these times of crisis.

She requests help with a loan from the Interactuar Corporation, to have working capital to invest it wisely during this difficult time, to buy supplies to make tamales as well as to buy shoes and clothes wholesale to sell them.

She hopes to overcome this crisis and enjoy herself in the future, next to her husband and her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of tamales, as well as to buy shoes and clothes wholesale and sell them.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 27 years old; she is a married woman. She started her business of selling animals to meet her household expenses. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives a simple life with her family in a town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a mother of ten children, six adult and four school-aged children. Her husband works hard as a fisherman, while Elizabeth helps her husband in doing this livelihood. They have been doing this for twenty years to earn a living and to support the needs of their family.

She is asking for a bigger amount of loan to buy fishing net and to pay for boat maintenance.

Elizabeth’s only wish is to live a harmonious life and have better means of living. She also wants to improve her business for her children’s education. She dreams for them to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and to pay for boat maintenance.

loans.name: Jaina

texts.en:
Jaina is 50 years old and has six children. Jaina is married and has two children are still in school.

Jaina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Jaina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jaina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jaina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rose Cory

texts.en:
Rose Cory is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rose Cory dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 31-year-old, married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

Maria aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
Parvina is young and hardworking woman. She is a married parent of a child. Parvina’s husband is a migrant in Russia. She is going to start a business with buying and selling clothes. She will sell clothes in a local market.

Parvina took part in a course “To Get Ahead” of women organization and received a certificate. She will manage the business alone. She is very hardworking woman and she will a good specialist in future.

Parvina is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy clothes for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena  was living a tough life some years ago. It was very difficult to meet her household expenditures. She is 41 years old, married and has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has nine children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 60000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales in order to earn a good amount of income. She hopes to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy works hard to support her child. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Analy requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF in order to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family without any diseases caused by contaminated water. Analy is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Riva

texts.en:
Riva is 40 years old and married with two children.  With both children in school, Riva works very hard to provide for them.

Riva has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Riva has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Riva would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juana Imarci

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer perseverante de cincuenta y tres años de edad, que descubrió su pasión en el comercio. Desde que tenía veintiocho años de edad con el apoyo de su esposo rento un pequeño local y empezó a ofertar ropa, calzado y accesorios, gracias a su buena administración y constante clientela ha logrado ser dueña de su propio local además de haberse posicionado como una buena comerciante del centro de compra donde está situada su tienda. 
En estos momentos, Juana ha recurrido a un préstamo de kiva junto a MiCrédito, para comprar ropa, calzado y accesorios variados porque cree es fundamental en esta temporada contar con productos que estén a la vanguardia de lo que la gente está buscando y comprando. En un futuro desea poder abrir otra tienda en otro centro de compra importante de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Juana is a persevering woman of fifty three, who discovered her passion for business. With the help of her husband, she rented a small place when she was twenty eight years old and started selling clothes, shoes and accessories. Thanks to her good management and steady clientele, she has been able to become the owner of her own space, in addition to positioning herself as a good merchant in the shopping center where her store is located.

Currently, Juana has turned to Kiva along with MiCrédito for a loan to buy clothes, shoes and assorted accessories because she believes it is critical, during this time, to have products that are in the forefront of what people are looking for and buying.

In the future, she would like to open another store in another major shopping center of her city.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and assorted accessories.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She is a single woman, running a sari-sari (variety) store business to support her family. She has been doing this for four years. Aside from this, she also engaged in buying and selling dried fish to the community. With this, Jane is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs and drinks. Other part of her loan is to buy dried fish to sell. In this way, Jane was able to enhance her earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs and drinks; dried fish

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 38 years old poultry farmer at Kisumu Kenya. She is a mother of three whose spouse provides with additional income.

For the last two years she has been in poultry farming and it has been sustainable as well as prosperous.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase feeds for her poultry and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. 

She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her poultry

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anita is 39 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Anita has a buy and sell coco lumber business in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more wood and coco lumber to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and coco lumber to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is ‎‏25‏‎ years old lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa. Mohammad is an ambitious man and example of nosy ‎person, he likes to know and understand everything to help him recognize the requirement of dealing with people or to ‎know the community requirements. He is studying accounting and he is also working in one of the cancer ‎hospitals, Mohammad believed that his job will help him to know about the secrets to be a fighter and patient man. His ‎family is facing financial difficulties; therefore he requested an education loan to cover his semester fees. ‎

loans.use: to help him cover his third year fees for a degree in Accountancy

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is thankful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) has partnered with Kiva to help entrepreneurs lacking capital to run a business. She’s grateful that CCT granted her previous loan of Php 10, 000 and also wants to thank lenders for participating in the Kiva program. The amount was used to buy additional products for the business.

The profit she’s earning is just enough for their day-to-day expenditures. She aims to have an array of products to offer to clients and obtain more patrons that will result in increased sales. She decided to apply for another loan of Php 10, 000 since she wants to have products on stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items to add to her variety store business.

On a weekly basis, Sharon regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience of the business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to acquire products to have on stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items to add to her variety store business.

loans.name: Lady Gaga Group

texts.en:
Arlen is the featured borrower of Lady Gaga Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. They have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon as housekeepers in order to provide their families with the necessary educational and living needs.

Arlen is a 54-year-old single mother of three children. She works as a housekeeper to provide her children with their living needs and education. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees. Arlen is the lady in the middle.

As for the other group members, Sarah is on the right, and Leah is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Cocibolca Group

texts.es: El grupo Cocibolca está integrado por Ariel, de 37 años, quien se encuentra casado y a su responsabilidad tiene 3 hijos quienes son su motor de vida. Su negocio es una pulpería, quien lo tiene desde 5 años con capital propio y ahora lo requiere para la inversión de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, y cosméticos, aceite, papel higiénico y ace. Para el consumo de la población. Las demás integrantes son Jeanett de 39 años, dedicada a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años. María de 41 años, dedicada a la venta de cosméticos, y ropa desde hace 2 años.
texts.en: Cocibolca group has Ariel as a member. He is 37, married with 3 children who are the fuel that keeps him going. He owns a grocery store that he's ran with his own capital for 5 years. Now, he wants to invest in basic grains such as rice, sugar, as well as cosmetics, oil, toilet paper and laundry detergent to sell to his neighbors. The rest of the members are Jeanett, 39, who's been selling clothes for 2 year and Maria, 41, who's been selling cosmetics and clothes for 2 years, as well.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, sugar, as well as cosmetics, oil, toilet paper and laundry detergent.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is age 34 and married. They're blessed with four children. She owns and manages a business which they sell candles and also makes gravestones/tombstones in her shop. She's been in this business for almost 12 years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 per day. Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like the help of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase marble and wax to use in her business. She's hoping that her income will continue to grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to purchase marble and wax to use in her business.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat has four children. He is a cobbler, which he has been doing for 15 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital to expand his business. 

Josphat requested a loan for 90,000 KES, which he will use to buy shoe making materials. In the future, he hopes that he will be able to export his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase shoe making materials

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is a 45 year old woman with 5 children. The eldest one is graduated from high school while 2 are still at school. Emiliana is a hard working woman who assists her husband – Petrus, a 45 year old bricklayer by running a business of selling cakes at home. This business aims to earn more money so she can cover their living needs as the income earned as the bricklayer won’t enable her to manage their needs.

She has been running this for 3 years. She enjoys this business as she has time to look after her children. She has planned to expand her business but it needs more money to purchase more baking ingredients such as, wheat, sugar, butter, cooking oil, etc. Given she could produce more cakes to sell and hopes to save some money for her children education cost.  Therefore, she was enthusiastic when a neighbor told her about the TLM loan product. She then joined in the existing group and requested a loan of IDR 2.000.000 from TLM. Emiliana just heard about Kiva but she was grateful as from Kiva through TLM she has a chance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baking ingredients such as wheat, sugar, butter and cooking oil.

loans.name: Goldie

texts.en:
Goldie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Goldie dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en: Sumaira is 32 years old and she is married. She lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband purchases clothes from the market which she then sells from her home and her husband sells from his clothing shop. In this way both contribute in their monthly income. They have been selling clothes for the summer season; now the weather is going change and the customers demand is for warm clothing. Sumaira is compelled to take a Kiva loan so she can buy warm clothing to offer her customers and to cope with the demand. In this way both she can offer warm clothes and can generate maximum income for her family. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy warm clothes for both herself as well as for her husband to cope with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Usha And Group

texts.en:
35-year-old Usha lives with her family of five in a village in Tamil Nadu. Her family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. She does not have the basic sanitation facility of a toilet at home. Without access to a toilet, she and her family have to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack and even insect or animal bites. 

Usha leads a group of five women who have come together to apply for a loan to construct toilets in their respective homes. They seek a loan to cover the cost of raw materials and labour for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health and safety.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for the construction of a toilet in her home

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 30-year-old woman living with her husband and three children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a responsible woman, and her husband is an honest person. He is the owner of a small manufacturing factory where he makes key chains, screw tide sets, etc. He needs to buy the inventory required for his business, therefore Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Farzana will be thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's business.

loans.name: Joshua School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Anne. She is the Director of Joshua Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Mbale, Uganda with 600 students. Joshua Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Joshua School will repay their loan from their school fees which they collect each term. Anne ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Eva María

texts.es: La Señora Eva María es casada y tiene 39 años de edad. Tienen dos hijos y el último de 18 años está estudiando. El préstamo ayudará para la compara de abonos para el mejoramiento de su parcela de tara y a tener mayores ingresos; dentro de los sueños y esperanzas de doña María Estela está dedicarse a la venta de artesanías y educar profesionalmente a su último hijo. Con 15 años de experiencia en el cultivo y negocio de la tara, lo que más le gusta, es que es un cultivo que no necesita de mucha mano de obra y que es rentable.
texts.en: Eva Maria is married and is 39 years old. She has two children and the oldest is an 18 year old student. The loan will help her buy fertilizer to improve her tara land and increase her income. Some of Eva Maria's hopes and dreams are to make a living selling crafts and to professionally educate her youngest child. With 15 years of experience in growing and sellling tara, she likes that it is a crop that does not require much labor and is profitable.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: La Bombita El Oro Group

texts.es:
Como es común en el Estado de México, las comunidades con orígenes prehispánicos tienen características que las definen como lugares naturalmente ricos y pintorescos. Sus habitantes son personas muy alegres quienes están orgullosas de sus raíces, de su historia, tradiciones y convivencia. La mayor parte de la población se dedica al comercio y el grupo La Bombita del Oro no es la excepción pues sus integrantes tienen una amplia experiencia en dicha labor.
   Doña Laura es una mujer comprometida con su familia y, aunque ya ninguno de sus cuatro hijos depende de ella, ha decidido ser independiente y continuar trabajando para lograr nuevo objetivos.
