Desde hace más de veintisiete años se ha dedicado, junto con su esposo, al negocio de la paileria que consiste en elaborar botes, tambos, asadores, tinas, vaporeras, entre otros productos de aluminio. Este negocio lo inició su esposo ya que sus padres le brindaron la técnica y experiencia para trabajar por su propia cuenta. Al inicio no contaban con herramienta suficiente ni con un taller en condiciones pero gradualmente pudieron superar estas contrariedades y actualmente pudieron ampliar el taller, comprar la herramienta, además de dar empleo a cinco personas más.
   La pareja realiza un buen trabajo en equipo ya que mientras Rafael, su esposo,  realiza el producto, Doña Laura sale a vender en comunidades aledañas o bien entrega la mercancía ya solicitada. "Hay días en que las ventas son muy buenas y días en que no tanto pero es nuestro negocio y nos gusta hacerlo" comentó contenta. 
   Esta es la primera vez que solicitan el apoyo de VFMéxico con el cual esperan comprar, sobre todo,  láminas de aluminio que representan el mayor gasto además de remaches y pintura. Ahora su única meta es aumentar la producción del producto para generar mejores ingresos. 
   Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosa, J. Carmen, Iván, Sandra y Clara quienes invertirán en la misma actividad que Laura, mientras que María del Carmen, en una tienda de abarrotes; Inés, en abarrotes y paletas de hielo y María José, en pescado.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Laura quien viste una chamara a cuadros.
texts.en:
As is common in Mexico, the communities with pre-Hispanic origins have characteristics that define them as places naturally rich and picturesque. The inhabitants are very happy people who are proud of their roots, history, traditions and social harmony. Most part of the population makes a living in trading and La Bombita del Oro group is no exception, since its members have a large experience in this area.

Laura is a woman committed to her family and, even if none of her four children is a dependent, she has decided to be independent and to continue working to achieve new objectives.

She has been making a living, together with her husband, with a welding business for more than twenty-seven years. They produce containers, drums, barbecues, barrels and food steamers, among other aluminium products. Her husband started this business because his parents showed him the technique and experience to work independently. At the beginning they did not count on enough tools or a workshop in good condition, but gradually they could overcome this difficulties. Nowadays, they have been able to enlarge the workshop, buy tools and also employ five more people.

The couple accomplishes good team work since while Rafael, her husband, makes the products, Laura goes to sell in nearby communities or delivers the goods already ordered. "There are days when sales are very good and days when they are not, but it is our business and we like to do it" she happily comments.

This is the first time that they are requesting VFMexico's support, which they expect to use to buy, mainly, aluminium sheets, since they represent the major expense, in addition to rivets and paint. Her goal is now to increase the product production to generate more income.

The other members of the group are Rosa, J. Carmen, Iván, Sandra and Clara who will invest in the same activity as Laura. Meanwhile, María del Carmen will invest in a grocery store; Inés, in groceries and ice-pops and María José in fish.

*The picture was taken in Laura's business, who is wearing a checkered sweater.

loans.use: to buy aluminium and rivets.

loans.name: Samini

texts.en: Samini is a married man. he has five children. he describes himself to be honest. he operates a supply business where he sells bread, sugar, flour and other items to other retailers. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. he describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. he will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy bread, flour, sugar and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy bread, flour, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
Ma. Elma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Ma. Elma dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman, 67 years old, with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Carmelita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fresh fish to sell to her local market.

Carmelita has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fresh fish to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Day by day, increasing expenditures compelled Mumtaz to initiate her own business of selling animals. She is a 59-year-old, married woman and has been doing business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees finds it difficult to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Balqees is a 49-year-old married mother of three children.

Some years ago she started a business selling livestock in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR.

She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Balqees has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Editha is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as margarine, eggs, hot dogs, and bread.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as margarine, eggs, hot dogs, and bread.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 43 years old and married with two children.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, eggs, and snack foods.

Lucita has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Lucita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, eggs, and snack foods.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 49 years old and married with four children, one still in school, Epefania works very hard to provide for her family.

Epefania runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, eggs, and snack foods.

Epefania has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Epefania would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, eggs, and snack foods.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a hardworking lady. She is a 36-year-old married woman. She initiated her business of selling milk, as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Rehana’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Rehana has requested 55,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, so she can provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, so she can provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en:
Yeth works as village chief in Chambok Prosat Village living with wife (both in the picture standing in-front of your house) and children. As a village chief, he needs to work a lot of paper work which some time can take her night time at night. However, his house doesn’t have reliable energy. He has to go to charge battery 1 or 2 time per week.

As a result, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan. He believes solar home system can help his family reduce utility cost and improve his working hour at night.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Chambok Prosat Village, Kraing Skea Commune, Toek

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina has been a consistent member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for many years and she’s grateful that they’re able to respond to her loan request quickly. The amount that they approved previously let her buy stocks of ready-to-wear clothes. She wants to thank, as well, all of the lenders who provided financial support without asking for  anything in return. Carolina wants to continuously support her family, which is why she’s hardworking and determined to make the business grow. Her goal is to have her children finish college and to maintain good health for her family. 

Carolina is involved in a pig farming business, selling poultry supplies, and selling ready-to-wear clothes. She's thankful to God for being blessed of having  those businesses. To have complete poultry supplies and a variety of clothes to sell is what she wants to maintain.  An approximate amount of Php 20, 000 is what she needs, which is why she applied for the loan. She's hoping that CCT would once again grant her loan request.

Carolina is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. There, she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays Micro Finance loans and  hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy varieties of ready-to-wear- clothes and poultry supplies.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 32 years old and is a hardworking mother of 2 children. She has been providing clothes sewing services in her area. She is quite popular for her sewing skills.

Safia’s work brought her family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientel.

Safia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with both some spools of thread and also lace so she can consistently meet customer demand.

Safia aspires to save money for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase both a new sewing machine with spools of thread and lace.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a food vendor and at the same time manages a hog-raising business. Her spouse is a farmer.

Rosemarie is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to use in her businesses. She will buy feed and vaccines for hogs and also invest in a food-vending business. She will buy flour and cooking oil.

She hopes to continuously offer delicious snacks and achieve a profitable hog-raising business someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs and also to invest in a food-vending business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has eight children. Her oldest child is 21 years old, while her youngest child is seven years old. Her husband raised them through their farm; thus, her husband is a farmer while Flordeliza sells imported used clothes known as “ukay-ukay”. She has been doing this for three years to earn and helps her husband in providing the needs of her children.

With this, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy imported used clothes to sell. Other part of her loan amount is to buy feed for her pigs and buy “tongog” (a tannin powder used by tuba gatherer to add color to the coconut wine). Definitely, Flordeliza is engaged in hog raising business while her husband gathers coconut wine known as “tuba”. In this way, she will be able to enhance her livelihood and augment her profit.

loans.use: to buy imported used clothes; feed; "tongog" (tannin powder)

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 37-year old married woman with five young dependent. She raises hogs to earn for a living. Her husband’s occupation is a tricycle (rickshaw) driver. He transport passenger to earn for a living.

For a quite period of years now, Anecita sold hogs the the local settlers in her community.

She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and materials like ply wood, nails and lumber for house repair. These will help boost and improve her earnings. She could now have a comfortable home for her family to live.

She could now able to raise quality hogs , thus causing her finance will augment.

In the future, Anecita is aiming to have a healthy family and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and materials like ply wood, nails and lumber for house repair

loans.name: Jay Liza

texts.en:
Jay Liza is a sari-sari (varieties) store owner. Sari-sari store is a small retail outlets that can be found in almost all neighborhoods, sometimes even on every street corner, in the Philippines. It is privately owned shop operated inside the store owner’s shop. Jay Liza is a 38-year-old woman has been operated this business for 8 years in the town of Carles, Iloilo. She has been doing this to support her family.

With this, she is asking for a loan to buy more commodities to sell, like drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, candies, chips, biscuits, salt, and sugar. In this way, her store looks full and it will attract more buyers. Jay Liza’s ultimate goal is to expand her business for their sustainability.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, candies, chips, biscuits, salt, and sugar

loans.name: Honey Lee

texts.en:
Honey Lee is always traveling to sell her various consumable products, which gives her an approximate income of PHP 10,000 per month. She needs to help her parents provide for the needs of their family, knowing her youngest sibling is already in college.

Honey Lee is 24 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC.

Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional capital so that she can supply the demands of her growing number of customers. The amount will be used to purchase additional stocks for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like tricycle passenger business.

Lita dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nazeera

texts.en:
Nazeera is a hard-working lady. She has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, Nazeera has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment, which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment, which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
It was hard for Yasmeen to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Yasmeen is 37 years old, a married woman. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Yasmeen has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Di

texts.en:
Mrs. Di is 36 years old, married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but has a lack of capital.

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan from fishing, farming and husbandry.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 44 years old and married. She has two children who are still in school.

Anita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Anita has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy a 8,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a 8,000 litre water

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes, maize. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy crop seeds for planting. His business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds for planting.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be intelligent. He operates a farm where he grows maize and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be floods.

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Aloura

texts.en:
Aloura is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aloura is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Aloura has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aloura requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, sticky rice, etc. for her food production business.

Aloura has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Aloura would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, sticky rice, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish and egg to sell to customers.

Evelyn has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and eggs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Juan Esteban

texts.es:
Juan, un joven de 18 años, vive en el municipio de La Dorada, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Este joven de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de comidas rápidas en el parque principal del municipio, tiene alquilado un pequeño local donde montara su empresa.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Juan podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que pagara sus estudios y aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas, algunas adecuaciones locativas y en la compra de surtido e ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Colabora a un joven emprendedor, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Juan, a young man of 18 years, lives in the municipality of La Dorada, a small city where there aren't many opportunities to get ahead and the market competition is pretty intense.

This young man with an entrepreneurial mind and the desire to improve his situation has plans to start a fast food business in the town's main park. He has rented a small space where he can set up his company.

With the help of a loan, Juan will be able to generate his own income and achieve his dream of being independent. He will be able to pay for his studies and contribute to the household expenses.

The money will be used to pay for tables, chairs, some on-site repairs, and supplies and ingredients for the preparation of food.

Collaborate with a young and creative entrepreneur with great dreams!

loans.use: to pay for tables, chairs, some on-site repairs, and supplies and ingredients for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Farzana is a house wife living with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Farzana husband’s works hard to support her family. He has an auto rickshaw transportation business in the Multan, Pakistan. 

Farzana is borrowing 40,000 PKR through BRAC Pakistan in order to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for her husband’s business.

Farzana has been sustaining her husband’s business activities through her past 2 loans from BRAC Pakistan. 
Farzana and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to repair auto rickshaw for her huband

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en:
Working as a farmer for over 5 years, Phoeurn lives with her husband and child in Teab Srov Village. As a young couple with a small child, Phoeurn and her husband work hard to improve their family's standard of living.

Phoeurn is always concerned for her only child's safety when she is not at home since her family uses a car battery for power that contains an acid substance. Moreover, she has to travel daily to charge the battery. It is a time and money consuming activity. Therefore, she decided to apply to Kiva for a loan to buy a solar home energy system.

If Phoeurn were to have a solar home system, she would be relieved to no longer worry about their child's safety. Her child can start the light by himself without help from an adult. Her family also can live more conveniently with brighter light.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home energy system.

location.town: Teab Srov Village, Banteay Preal Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Cantabon, Siquijor, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Stanley feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used to his business.

Recently, he availed a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce. Stanley wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce

loans.name: Amarilis Esperanza

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soñadores Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan, cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Amarilis  tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 9 meses de edad. Su esposo es empleado público.
Amarilis es una mujer que le gusta ganarse sus propios recursos gracias a su esfuerzo y así ganarse la vida, para esto  ella en tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también  legumbres, verduras y frutas, carnes, colas, helados y otros productos, tiene muy buena clientela la cual ha logrado tener en más de 8 años que lleva con su negocio y que le permiten ganarse la vida honradamente.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad, legumbres, carnes y otros víveres para abastecer su tienda. Lleva 8 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
The loan group Soñadores Del Futuro ("Dreamers of the Future") meets every fifteen days in the canton Paján, known to be a major cattle farming area within the province.  A local attraction is the Montubio rodeo, organized during certain times of the year.

This is where Amarilis lives.  She is 39 years old, has a common law marriage, and from this relationship she has a 9 month old son.  Her husband is a public employee.

Amarilis is a woman who likes to earn her resources by her own effort and thus make a living.  For this purpose she has a convenience store in her home, where she sells all types of basic necessities as well as beans, vegetables, fruit, meat products, sodas, ice cream, and other products.  She has a very good clientele that she has gained over the 8 years she has had her business, who allow her to make an honest living.  

She is going to use this loan to buy basic goods, beans, meat products, and other provisions to stock her store.  She has done 8 loan cycles with the group, which she likes because thanks to the loans she was able to start her business.  Her dream is to give the best to her child.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities, beans, meat products, and other provisions

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina has been involved in activities since 2008. She started her business with her own working capital of $500.00. Her husband is agriculture. So she is requesting a loan of $1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to people like, including milk, aqua, candles, eggs,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, coffee and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks. She hopes to make her business bigger in the future

loans.use: to buy milk, aqua, candles, eggs,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, coffee, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn owns an auto repair shop in Nonoc, Larena, Siquijor. Being a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she diligently pays all of her obligations from the earnings from her shop.

Recently, Jenelyn applied for a loan to purchase motor lubricants and a shop toolkit. She is adding a satellite shop in a nearby barangay (village), and she wishes to earn more with this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase motor lubricants and a shop toolkit.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen has been doing a business of shoe-making for many years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is responsible for taking care of the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and clothing. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living.

With the support of Kashf Foundation she is fulfilling her dreams and is able to manage her children’s education. Now she requested for a 50000 PKR to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc. In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence, better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, a farmer, live in Tropaing Mlou village with wife(both in the picture standing in-front of their house) and children. Beside farming, Sary owns a pig feeding farm. As a farmer and also businessman, he wants to expand his business with 6 hectare big land and making his family living in comfortable condition.

However,his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day.

Therefore, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Tropaing Mlou Village, Kraing Skea Commune, Toek P

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analiza is a 28-year-old woman with two children, ages seven and five. With her eagerness to help her husband, she managed to establish a small store in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She generates a very good income, which supports her children’s school fees and food for the household.

Analiza needs a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, chocolate bars, candies, biscuits, coffee, sugar, drinks, and personal care products.

Her greatest dream is to own a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, chocolate bars, candies, biscuits, coffee, sugar, drinks, and personal care products.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia is a 64-year-old hardworking mother from Ozamiz City.  She buys whole coconuts to make copra. Ignacia joined the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts to make copra. Ignacia hopes to succeed in this business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman, 49 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Imelda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her local market.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Imelda has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married mother who is 60 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a buy-and-sell spice business in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase different kinds of spices to sell to her customers.

Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of spices to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Palmina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Palmina, a sus 26 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. Ser independiente, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenzó a comercializar productos de uso personal para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará mercancía al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada navideña, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Palmina manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora.
texts.en: At 26 years of age, Palmina is a charismatic, active and helpful woman. Becoming independent was her main objective to fight tirelessly day by day, looking for alternatives to earn her living. Approximately 5 years ago, she started selling products of personal use, of very good quality and excellent prices for all types of customers. This allowed her to be known in the area and have a good track record. She works every day for 8 hours. This impulses her to request a loan to strengthen her inventory, because she will buy merchandise at wholesale prices. This way she will be able to satisfy the demand that increases this Christmas season. This will help her improve the income she earns with her work. Palmina states that her age does not hinder her from doing what she loves. Therefore, she is always setting new goals, one of them being that of becoming a great distributor.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale prices in order to satisfy the demand that increases this Christmas season.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 52-year-old married woman blessed with five children between the ages of 15 and 26.

She has been a butcher for eight years and earns a monthly income of 35,000 KSH. She has had 5 loans with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy cattle, goats and sheep.

She will use her profits to buy food, increase her share, and re pay the loan. Her dream is to expand the business and live happily.

loans.use: to buy cattle, goats, and sheep.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 47-year-old married woman with five children, two attend school.

Marites has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 29-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marivic has had an oyster business for 9 years and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of oysters to sell to her local market.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of oysters to sell to her local market

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is a father of five children who lives in Rawalpindi ,Pakistan. He owns a stationary shop and is making a profit. He believes that he could get a lot in return if he is able to invest a little more into his business. He wants to restock his stationary items and needs a loan so to help his business flourish.

Jameel pays his regards to KIVA Team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in his stationary shop.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelita is a 61-year-old woman and a resident Baybay, Leyte. She is married and blessed with three grown children. Angelita helps her husband to provide for the needs of their family through making mats to sell. She used “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) leaves. The “buri” leaves are used in various products such as mats, native bags, farmer’s hats, and sometimes it can be used as props. Angelita has had this business for six years. She needs a loan to buy “buri” leaves and dye. In addition, she plans to buy piglets and feed. Angelita plans to start other business opportunities like raising pigs in order to enhance her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy “buri” leaves, dye, piglets, and feed.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 33-year-old married man blessed with two children who are 14 and 8 years old.

He has sold charcoal and milk for fifteen years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KSH.

This is his seventh loan with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to buy more charcoal and milk to resale in the village. He will use the profits to pay school fees for their children.

His dream is to buy a motorbike to transport his milk to the factory.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and milk.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 62-year-old married woman with seven children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 6 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, and snack foods.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and needs another loan to further build her businesses.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid 9 previous loans. She earns additional income raising pigs.

Merlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, and snack foods.

loans.name: Jenny Margine

texts.es:
La tradición por la venta de ropa usada, es uno de los trabajos de Jenny, pues desde pequeña ayudaba a su madre en la tienda arreglando las prendas de segunda mano que vendía. Ahora, a sus 27 años de edad, ella ya lleva más de diez años con su propio negocio. Anteriormente ella había solicitado un préstamo para comprar ropa, lo que le trajo muy buenos resultado y lo que ella dice le asegura el futuro a su hijo de dos años de edad. Razón por la cual se siente muy agradecida con quienes le apoyaron en ese último financiamiento.  
Jenny tiene el apoyo de su madre y de su esposo, quienes la motivan a seguir creciendo con su negocio. Razón por la cual solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar ropa usada al por mayor, pues considera que tiene mayores ganancias haciendo las compras de esa forma. En sus otros planes ella desea invertir en su casa, pues no solo quiere crecer en su trabajo, sino también mejorar la calidad de su vida y de la de su familia.
texts.en: Selling second hand clothes is a tradition for Jenny, who since she was young would help her mother at the store organizing the second hand clothing items she used to sell. Now, at 27, she has had her own business for more than ten years. Previously, she had requested a loan to buy clothes, which gave very good results, and what she says assures the future of her two year old son. This is the reason why she feels very grateful to those who supported her in her first loan. Jenny has her mother's and husband's support, who motivate her to keep on growing with her business. This is the reason why she is requesting a new loan to buy second hand clothes, because she considers she has bigger earnings making purchases this way. Among her other plans, she wants to invest in her house, because she does not only want to grow in her work, but also improve the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is a 37-year-old married woman with three school-aged children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Niña has had a vegetable vending business for 4 years and needs 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell to her customers.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of 3 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

Manzooran aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a Kiva borrower with 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to she will have improved living standards within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Like many women it was financial constraint that played a potent factor in encouraging Raheela to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan.

Raheela is a 33-year-old married mother of 3 children. In order to help her husband take care of the family she began her milk selling business. She owns buffaloes for milking and she is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She is happily supporting her family with the income she earns.

Raheela has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo so she can increase her sales and generate more income to cover their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a hardworking lady. She initiated her business selling milk as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband (also shown in the photo). She is a 38 -year-old married woman.

She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Ishrat’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Ishrat has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
For the past three years, Narcisa has engaged in hog raising as her livelihood. She raises and sells pigs to the local settlers in her place. She is a 36-year-old married woman with two-school-aged children. Her husband works in construction. Her income goes for food and school expenses.

Narcisa has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. These are very essential for the progress of her livelihood. She could raise more hogs and her income will slowly improve. In that way, she will be able to save for future use. The revenues will be used to continue expand her hog-raising business.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage them successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Rossana Janeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soñadores Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan, cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
Aquí vive la señora Rossana, tiene 45 años  de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos dos ya mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 12 años, los menores estudian en colegio y son los que  aun viven en su casa. 
Rossana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así con el fruto de su esfuerzo ir mejorando su calidad de vida para ella y sus hijos, ella tiene una fabrica en la cual procesan café, ella compra  a productores de la zona ya que este cantón es muy rico en este producto y de muy buen aroma razón por el cual su producto se vende muy bien, ella junto a sus hijos mayores son los encargados de mantener todo en orden brindando un producto de mucha calidad ya que esta es su carta de presentación para ir ganando mas clientela con el paso de los días, ellos entregan a tiendas en la ciudad de Manta y Guayaquil y esperan con el paso del tiempo copar todo el territorio nacional, llevan 17 años con esta empresa y siempre les deja buenos beneficios.
Este crédito es para comprar café. Lleva año y medio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos, sus sueños es entregar a todo el país sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Soñadores Del Futuro" ("Dreamers of the Future") gathers together every 15 days in the Pajan canton, which is known for being a livestock zone of the province. One of its attractions is the Montubio-style rodeo that takes place a few times a year.
This is where Rossana lives. She's 45 years old and single. She has four children, two of whom are already adults and two are 17 and 12 years old. The younger children are in school and still live with her.
Rossana is a woman who likes to work and then, with the fruits of her labor, she gradually improves her and her family's living conditions. She owns a production facility where coffee is processed. She buys it from local producers because this canton is very rich in fragrant coffee, which is why her product sells very well. Alongside her adult children, she's in charge of keeping everything in order. She provides a high quality product, since this is her letter of presentation, a means to gain more customers with each passing day. They deliver to stores in the town of Manta and Guayaquil, and they hope to cover the entire national territory over time. They have had this business for 17 years and it always earns them good profits.
This loan is to purchase coffee. She has been with the communal bank for a year and a half, and she enjoys it because of how fast the loans come in. Her dream is to deliver her products all over the country.

loans.use: to purchase coffee.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is a 61-year-old married woman with four grown children. She earns a living by engaging in a direct-selling business. She sells Avon products like lotion, bags, and beauty products. Aside from that, she also sells firewood.

She has requested a loan to purchase Avon products and firewood. These will help boost and improve her earnings. Thus, her income will improve. She could now be able to purchase firewood in bulk.

In the future, Roberta is hopeful that she will become successful in her chosen field.

loans.use: to purchase Avon products and firewood.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 34 years old and married with five children.

Rovelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Rovelyn has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Rovelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rahmawati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rahmawati. Rahmawati is a housewife who has been blessed with one daughter and her husband who works as a staff in a local private company. Rahmawati realized that they have to save more money to continuously support their daughter’s education. Therefore, to support her family, she runs a business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving utility bill payments in her community.

As a stay-at-home mom, she has an advantage to sell to her peers who are mostly housewives in her neighborhood. These customers are getting familiar with mobile phones and internet – which is a good thing. As the demand for transactions increase, Rahmawati is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. Rahmawati is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 61 years old, married, and has three children.

Rita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Syrene

texts.en:
Syrene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Syrene is 41 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Syrene has a weaving business in the Philippines. Syrene requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like abacca, silk, and other materials for her business.

Syrene has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like abacca, silk and other materials for her business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Day by day, increasing expenditures compelled Parveen to initiate her own business selling animals. She is a 51-year-old married woman doing business with help from her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.

Parveen is a mother of 3 children. She works very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

Parveen has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves.

loans.name: Jonathan Jose

texts.es:
Jonathan creció admirando el deporte tradicional de Nicaragua, el beisbol, cuenta que los fines de semana, siempre iba a ver al parque a jugar, mientras sus padres salían a trabajar en sus taxis, o miraba en las noches las ligas nacionales por la televisión, sin saber que años después iba a tener la oportunidad de convertirse en uno de esos jugadores profesionales en su país. Ahora tiene 26 años, está casado, trabaja en proyectos que le gusta, lleva más de diez años jugando beisbol y tiene una pequeña hija de dos años de edad que lo inspira a salir adelante.  
Durante este trayecto, Jonathan tuvo otros sueños por cumplir como estudiar Ingeniería en Zootecnia, carrera que finalizó, sin embargo no de la cual no obtuvo el título, debido a que no tuvo en ese momento los recursos económicos necesarios. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para pagar su título y aprovechar para pagar un diplomado para seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos y empezar a optar por puestos en esta otra etapa de su vida. En sus planes está seguir estudiando, al igual que seguir ejerciendo como beisbolista, así como realizar proyectos sociales en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jonathan grew up admiring the traditional sport of Nicaragua, baseball. He recalls always going to the park on weekends to watch the games while his parents went out to work in their taxis. Or watching the National League games on television at night without knowing that years later he would have the opportunity to become one of the professional players in his country.

Now he is 26 years old, is married and he works in projects that he enjoys. He has been playing baseball for ten years and has a small two year old daughter who inspires him to get ahead.

During this journey, Jonathan had other dreams to fulfill such as studying animal husbandry engineering, a course that he finished but did not obtain his degree as at that time he did not have the needed economic resources.

This is the reason he is requesting a loan to pay for his degree and take advantage of the loan to pay for post graduate course to continue to enrich his knowledge and begin determining employment for another stage in his life. Amongst his plans are to continue his studies as well as continue to play baseball and carry out some social projects in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his degree and post grad courses.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her child. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF in order to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family without any diseases caused by contaminated water. Elsie is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn works hard to support her family. Renalyn is single with one child and has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines.

Renalyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Renalyn has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Renalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Dominggos

texts.en: Dominggos has been involved in activities since 2012. He started his business with his own working capital of $500. He is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin because he wants to buy additional supplies like cement, sand, and stone to make bricks. He also sells gasoline and other things. He is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, he can build his business in the future and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, stone and gasoline.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta, age 67, operates a small family farm to earn income. She and her husband have been planting, harvesting, and selling rice for 20 years to satisfy their everyday needs. They have seven children, who are all grownups. Vicenta and her husband have worked very hard over the years to support their children. The family lives in Calape, Bohol.

In the future, Vicenta hopes to improve their standard of living. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers for the coming planting season. A portion of the loan proceeds will also be used to pay laborers.

At her age, Vicenta’s goal is to make a solid living to further support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Emilio Cecilio

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soñadores Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan, cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive don Emilio, tiene 43 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.
Emilio es un hombre muy trabajador que realiza lo necesario para darle a su familia una vida aceptable, el tiene un quiosco en la cual vende carne de res, su local está ubicado en un lugar muy propicio para sus ventas además que ya cuenta con muy buena clientela ya que vende carne fresca y al peso y precio justo, lo cual le ha llevado a de a poco ir ganando cada vez mas clientela, trabaja todos los días en este lugar, desde hace mas de 10 años que lleva en este negocio el cual con constancia y trabajo ha sacado adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar carne de res para sus ventas diarias. Lleva más de 1 año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que gracias a los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
The loan group "Soñadores del Futuro" (Dreamers of the Future) meets every two weeks in the Pajan canton, a canton known for being a very cattle-raising zone. One attraction in the province is the Montubio rodeo, which they organize in some seasons of the year.

Don Emilio lives in this place. He is 43 years old. He is married and from this relation they have two children, ages 20 and 16. Both are in school. His wife is a housewife.

Emilio is a very hard-working man who does what is necessary to give his family a suitable life. He has a kiosk where he sells beef. His shop is located in a very favorable place for his sales. In addition, he already has a very good clientele, since he sells fresh meat by the pound and at a fair price, which has led to his gradually winning more and more customers. He has worked in this place every day for the more than 10 years that he has been in this business, which he has advanced with determination and work.

This loan is to buy beef for his daily sales. He has been in the loan group for more than a year, and he likes it since thanks to the loans, he is advancing. His dreams are to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy beef.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a woman with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, and 2 of her children are in school.

Mary Jane has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, fruit, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 46 years old and has 5 children. She is married and 2 of her children are in school.

Mabel is in the agriculture business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mabel has been in this business for 4 years now, and she has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Walkiria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Walkiria es maestra desde hace mucho tiempo intercambia sus conocimientos con niños de primaria para prepararlos en el mundo profesional y personal. Sin embargo, esta docente no solo se ha sentido apasionada por la educación, sino también por el comercio, pues simultáneamente vendía prendas, sin embargo, no fue hasta hace tres años que ella decidió emprender en una pulpería, que pronto ha venido a dar grandes resultados en su vida económica.
Afortunadamente, Walkiria tiene el apoyo de sus hijas, quienes atienden el negocio cuando ella está dando clases. Esto la ha hecho sentirse más segura que su pulpería ira creciendo rápidamente. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar golosinas, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles y mercadería navideña para aprovechar la temporada. Con esto podrá surtir su negocio y tener buenas ganancias, para ahorrar y así cumplir con su meta de comprar su propia casa, pues vive en la de su madre.
texts.en:
Walkiria has been a teacher for many years. She shares her knowledge with elementary school kids in order to prepare them for the professional and personal worlds.

However, this teacher feels passionate not only for education, but also for business. She used to sell clothing at the same time, but it wasn't until three years ago that she decided to start a grocery store. It has quickly yielded great results in her economic life.

Fortunately, Walkiria has the support of her daughters, who tend the store while she is giving classes. This has made her feel more secure that her grocery store will continue growing quickly.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy sweets, drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and Christmas merchandise to take advantage of the season. With this loan, she will be able to stock her store and have a good income, so that she can save up to fulfill her dream of buying her own house. She lives in her mother's house.

loans.use: to buy sweets, drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Sj Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al  banco comunal “Los Emprendedores SJ”, ubicado en la provincia del Cusco.

Jackeline  es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora que tiene una piñatería, ella tiene 29 años  y desea tener una mejor calidad de vida. La socia atiende su negocio desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la tarde y sabe que cuanto más variedad de piñatas  ofrezca a sus clientes ella podrá tener mejores ingresos para su hogar.
 La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar piñatas, y así  poder seguir ampliando su negocio por fiestas de fin de año.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de venta de abarrotes, a la construcción, a la crianza de animales y trabajar en una  institución pública.
Los socios que están adjuntos en la fotografía grupal se les tomo la imagen después de la reunión por que pidieron permiso por motivos laborales.

Los socios están contentos con el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA, y se comprometen a cumplir sus cuotas en el plazo acordado.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Los Emprendedores SJ" (The SJ Entrepreneurs), located in the province of Cusco.

Jackeline is an entrepreneurial and hard-working member who has a piñata shop. She is 29 years old and wants to have a better quality of life. She tends her business from 9 in the morning to 7 at night, and she knows that the more variety of piñatas she offers her customers, the more income she will be able to have for her household.

She is applying for the loan to buy piñatas and thus be able to continue expanding her business for the celebrations at the end of the year.

The other members work in businesses of selling groceries, construction, raising animals, and working in a public institution.

The members' photos that were added to the group photograph were taken after the meeting because they asked permission for work reasons.

The members are happy about the loan granted by the Kiva investors, and they promise to make their payments on the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to buy piñatas.

loans.name: Al Jana 50380 Group

texts.en:
Sahar is the featured borrower for Al Jana 50380 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and their living at the same time.

Sahar is a 33-year-old married mother of one child. Three years ago, she started working as a tutor from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is well known among her region. Due to the low income of her family, Sahar is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's school tuition fees. Sahar is the first one on the left.

With respect to the other group members, Fatima (the lady in the middle) is a 23-year-old single lady who works as an accountant in a company and wants to pay her university tuition fees. Ghiwa (second lady on the right) is a 20-year-old single lady who sells accessories and perfumes and wants to pay her university tuition fees. Rania (first on the right) is a 30-year-old married woman who has a mobile phone shop and wants to develop her business. And Samira (second on the left) is a 24-year-old married mother of three who works as a hairdresser and wants to develop her business.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 22 years old, single, and has a child. She borrowed a loan to buy additional materials for her seaweed business. Her boyfriend is working abroad and she wanted to help him out with his business, so that she may able to support the needs of her son and give her son a bright future. With God's help she wants to expand her business, get married when her boyfriend comes home soon, and help her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Thun is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in Kampong Thom province. She has two dependent children, one of whom is still in school. She supports her family’s living through growing rice and working for others for a fee. These two businesses earn her about USD 15 per day and she can manage to save about USD 8 each day for future needs. Drought and pests made her rice crop to produce outputs which were lower than expected.

Thun, who is new to VisionFund, is now requesting a loan to pay for tuition fees for her son who is pursuing his Bachelor's degree in Accounting. She hopes to see her son have a chance to study in university and become a successful man in society.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees of her son who is pursuing his Bachelor's degree in Accounting.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Фируза. Ей 29 лет. Она имеет две дочери. Ее муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов загранице. Фируза уроженка города Турсунзаде. Она занимается земледелием у себя во дворе. Фируза серьезно относиться к работе. Она дольше времени проводить на земле. Фируза заботливая и трудолюбивая мать. Она не ждет отправки деньги мужа, и самостоятельно трудиться, чтобы кормить и одевать детей. Фируза хочет готовить землю к новому посеву и обработать почву минеральными удобрениями. Ей нужно определенное количество минеральных удобрений. Фируза просит кредит для купли минеральных удобрений.  Ваша поддержка поможет ей закончить посев и собрать качественный и здоровый урожай.
texts.en:
Meet Firuza, a 29-year-old native of the city of Tursunzoda and the mother of two daughters.  Her husband works as a handyman and renovates houses abroad.  Firuza herself has her own small farming business at home.  She is very serious about her work and spends a lot of time on her land.  She is also a caring and hardworking mother.  She doesn't wait for the money that her husbands sends home, but works at her own business in order to feed and clothe her children.

At the moment, Firuza would like to prepare her soil for the coming planting season and treat it with mineral fertilizers.  She needs a certain amount of mineral fertilizers and she is taking a loan to make this purchase.  Thanks to your support, she will be able to plant new crops and to get a high-quality and healthy harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Being a farmer, Rin, who is a 48-year-old married woman, can only make USD 5 per day to support her family. Rin is living with her husband as a farmer on the rice field. They have six children and live in a community of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. Rin has been involved in this business sector for nearly 10 years.

Rin would like to get a Kiva loan now in order to build a new hygienic latrine in her house. She is very happy with this loan since it will promote good health, a good environment and good living standards in her house. She would like to thank all of the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a new hygienic latrine

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca de 42 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía sus tres hijos de 7, 10 y 17 años de edad, de los cuales uno de ellos aporta un poco con los gastos del hogar. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida gracias a que con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su propio negocio de venta de pupusas, con el que gracias a su amabilidad ha logrado ganarse numerosos clientes que la visitan y  recomiendan siendo esa la manera como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos brindándoles todo lo necesario para su desarrollo y crecimiento, además de proporcionar el alimento a su hogar.  Blanca desea realizar unas reparaciones en la cocina de su hogar  debido que el techo en esa área presenta deterioro e ingresa el agua en épocas de lluvia lo que hace ser incomodo estar ahí, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: compra de láminas, tornillos, polines, etc., para llevar acabo la reparación del techo de la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en: Blanca is 42 years old. She lives in her own home with her three children, aged 7, 10 and 17. One of them contributes a little bit to the household expenses. She is a hardworking woman who earns a living thanks to having her own pupusa business that she has been able to have thanks to her hard work. Because of her friendliness, she has been able to earn several customers who visit her and recommend her. That is how she earns her income with which she has gotten her children ahead, giving them everything they need for their development and growth, in addition to keeping them fed at home. Blanca wants to do some repairs on the kitchen in her home, because the roof over that area has deteriorated and water gets in during the rainy season, which makes it uncomfortable to be there. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in  buying sheeting, screws, rods, etc., to do the repairs on the roof over the kitchen in her home.

loans.use: to invest in buying sheeting, screws, rods, etc. to do the repairs on the roof over the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Elizabel Nitida

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Al Poder se reúne cada quince días en Cascol el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Elizabel tiene 70 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, una hija aun vive con ella.
Elizabel es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ganarse la vida,  ella tiene un local en su casa donde vende balanceado, maíz, químicos y otros alimentos y medicinas para aves de corral y ganado porcino y vacuno, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que cuenta con muy buena clienta que ha podido lograr en estos 35 años que lleva dedicada a este negocio, los créditos para ella son muy buenos y siempre agradece a dios la ayuda que recibe con ellos.
Este crédito es para comprar balanceado, maíz y otros productos que vende en su local. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Al Poder" communal bank meets every fortnight in Cascol in Pajan Canton. This canton is known as the livestock area of the province. One of it's attractions is the Montubio rodeos that are organized at different times during the year.

Elizabel lives in this place. She is 70 years old and her husband passed away a number of years ago and she was left a widow. But from this relationship she has four adult children and one daughter still lives with her.

Elizabel is a woman who likes to work to earn her living. She has a shop at her house where she sells balanced feed, corn, chemicals and other foods and medicine for poultry, pigs and cattle. Her sales are very good as she has a good clientele that she has managed to gain in the 35 years she has worked in this business.

This loan is to buy balanced feed, corn and other products that she sells in her shop. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it for the support she gets from the loans. Her dream is to continue progressing and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and corn.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 45 years old and single. Mabel works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Mabel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Mabel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, junk foods, oil, soy sauce, dried fish etc.

In the future, Mabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 41 years old and has eight children. With four children in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Maribel has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as hopia, candies, toiletries, condiments, coffee, etc.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida supports the family through her business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Leonida with her daughter Leslievan, who is 17 years old and is the second of three children in the family.

Leonida is borrowing 20,770 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Leslievan, who is studying for her Bachelor's of Science in Radiologic Technology. Leslievan is currently in her first year of this four-year course.

When she graduates, Leslievan plans to be a radiologist and help her mother send her younger sibling to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Marietha is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marietha is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marietha has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marietha requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetable, oil, sugar, etc.

Marietha has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marietha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, vegetable, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Jamil. Jamil is one of the Ruma agents who live in Bekasi, the satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. He is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with two daughters.

As the head of the family, his main source of income comes from working in a local private company. Last year Jamil met a Ruma field staff who introduced him to Ruma. He decided to join Ruma by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving utility bill payments to his surrounding community. He joined Ruma because he wants to learn how to become an entrepreneur, as well as contribute more to his community.

As the business runs, Jamil hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime and bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Jamil plans to add more products from Ruma to the things he serves, such as e-commerce for low-income communities. Jamil is the one who is seen in the photo. He feels thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Эту спокойную и честную женщину зовут Рахима. Ей 28 лет, замужем и мать четверых детей. Её муж мастер по ремонту домов, а сама Рахима занимается шитьем женских платьев. Этим делом она занимается уже 10 лет. Также Рахима занимается животноводством, эта деятельность очень важна для неё, так как она обеспечивает семью всеми молочными продуктами.
